He insisted the commission announced by the government on 28 March is "insufficient" because it would not be able to reach any conclusion and demanded that a judicial commission should be constituted. He said the judiciary should have fulfilled its responsibility in this matter, otherwise it would be considered a "failure" on its behalf.

Raja claimed interference in judicial affairs has been present in all cases of "political nature" and some judges appear to be scared, while others show courage. He warned if judges are not free to give judgements without any pressure or threat, the country would not be able to progress.

Independent politician Mustafa Nawaz Khokhar said as a lawyer, he is disappointed by the announcement regarding the government forming a commission because he expected the Supreme Court to take a suo moto notice in the case and hold an open proceeding. He claimed the government is just a "rubber stamp" and it is useless to hand this matter over to it. He noted the allegations are very serious and have raised questions over the entire judicial system.

Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) politician Khurram Dastgir said Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has stepped forward as the "elected representative of the people" and has taken a responsibility which does not directly fall under his duties. He noted the responsibility to take up this matter was on the judiciary because the letter had been addressed to it.

Dastgir said details of the allegations are yet to be gathered and the commission which has been announced should be allowed to do its work and "prove through its conduct" that it would take up the issue seriously. He was hopeful that the letter written by the six judges will help in "taking Pakistan forward". He remarked the present situation is a "test of the political wisdom" of all political players. He was of the view that "partial justice" will not work and it cannot be said that only the cases concluded in the last one year are wrong, while judgements in the earlier cases should be accepted.

Source: Samaa TV, Karachi, in Urdu 1500 GMT 28 Mar 24

title: Key themes from India's TV news channels 6 Mar 24
snippet:
The following are the main themes on evening prime-time shows on Indian TV news channels that aired on 5 March 2024.

Highlights
body:
- Intermediate coverage highlighting developments in Maldives, China ties

- Extensive coverage of political narratives on forthcoming elections

- Intermediate coverage of alleged gang rape of foreign tourist

Maldives, China ties 

Privately-owned, nationalist English-language TV news channel, WION, on its show "Gravitas" (at 21:00 IST or 15:30 GMT) highlighted Indian concerns over ties between the Maldives and China.

The anchor said, "India and China are ready for war in the Indian Ocean. Tension is building up not too far from the Indian mainland. In the Maldives, China is laying the foundation for an outpost and Beijing has signed a secret defence deal with Male."

The anchor added, "What this deal encompasses, one cannot tell for sure and China will not tell. Meet Mohamed Ghassan - he is the Defence Minister of Maldives and he met with Zhang Baoqun, who is China's deputy director of international military cooperation. The two men met in Male. They shook hands and signed the deal."

The anchor mentioned, "The elated Ministry of Defence of the Maldives then announced that China will be providing military assistance to the Maldives. But the question is at what cost and in exchange for what? Perhaps using the Maldives as an outpost?"

The anchor added, "What Male is failing to see here is that this is not a friendly neighbour trying to help a poor island nation. The dragon's [China's] designs are not benign and it's not seeking a partnership with the Maldives. China, in fact, is preparing for war with India in the Indian Ocean and it is looking for a platform."

The anchor also said, "The Maldives and its dreams of partnership with China are just collateral damage, serving as nothing but a platform for China to set up a base in India's backyard."

Another privately-owned, prominent English-language TV news channel, NDTV 24X7, on its show, "Left, Right & Centre" (at 21:30 IST or 16:00 GMT) also highlighted this development.

Anchor Vishnu Som said, "The equation between India and the Maldives, which has been fairly testy over the last couple of months, seems to have hit a new roadblock with the government of [Maldivian President] President Mohamed Muizzu signing a new agreement with China where China has apparently offered free military aid to Male."

Som added, "This comes at a time when the Chinese 'spy ships', 'research vessels' is what they call them, have been docking in Maldivian ports. It also comes at a time when there's been concerns raised by the Maldivian opposition on what exactly the President is doing."

He further mentioned, "The President making it quite clear that China is the country that he sees equations with, perhaps most closely. India not in that equation, at least not in the way it once was. What's more, the Maldives has made it clear that they want Indian [military] personnel off the island."

Speaking on the show, Dr RK Radhakrishnan, India-based expert on Maldives, said, "A lot has changed… The couple of people [opposition leaders] who had backed the motion [against President Muizzu] had backed out because Muizzu offered them ministerships or good positions in government… Number two, the delay in the election [reportedly from March to now in April]… gives Muizzu enough and more time to actually come with a coercive response to the Indian offer that civilians will replace military personnel in the Island."

Political narratives on general elections   

Privately-owned, pro-government English-language TV news channel, India Today, on its show, "News Today" (at 21:10 IST or 15:40 GMT) discussed political narratives regarding the forthcoming general elections.

Anchor Rajdeep Sardesai asked Rahul Verma of think tank Centre for Policy Research, "You are hearing the Prime Minister [PM] Narendra Modi go across the country on this whistle-stop tour, speaking of his dream of a 'developed India'. Of course, he attacks the opposition on familialism and other issues but the core of his appeal is 'I am going to give you [people] a dream of a stronger, stable India'."

"On the other hand, [opposition Congress party leader] Rahul Gandhi, on his 'Nyaya Yatra' [march for justice] is going along raising issues like… people are unemployed and that the… [people from so-called lower castes] are losing out. So, you have two clear narratives emerging. How do you see this playing out politically?" he added.

Verma said, "What we saw in that survey ['Mood of the Nation' survey conducted by the channel] that there is a disjunction between what voters think on questions relating to economy and how they are behaving politically. Price rise, unemployment there was [of] high concern. There was support for [a] nationwide caste census… A large number of people agree with these issues but on the political side, they seem to be thinking that [the] Modi government is doing well."  

He said, "PM Modi remains popular and people are much more likely to vote for BJP [Bharatiya Janata Party] in comparison to [the] past. So, what this suggests that perhaps voters do not have enough trust on opposition to be able to deliver on some of those issues which concern them."

Another popular, pro-government Hindi TV news channel, Aaj Tak, on its show "Black and White" (at 21:15 IST or 15:45 GMT) also focused on this news.

Anchor Sudhir Chaudhary said, "Are opposition parties trying to win the [lower house of parliament] Lok Sabha election by insulting [Hindu deity] Lord Ram and Hinduism? Is it not that while criticising PM Modi and protesting against them, these opposition leaders have in fact now started to insult Lord Ram himself?"

Chaudhary added, "[southern state] Tamil Nadu's DMK [Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam] party MP and former UPA [United Progressive Alliance government] minister A Raja, in his new statement, has said that he does not believe in Lord Ram and [Hindu epic] Ramayana and does not even believe that [Hindu deity] Lord Hanuman is a god."

He mentioned, "DMK is the same party whose leader Udhayanidhi Stalin had compared Hinduism with diseases such as dengue and malaria. DMK's MP Senthilkumar had said that the people of north India are simply confined to cows and 'gau mutra' [cow urine]. And now, the same party's MP A Raja, while taking advantage of freedom of expression, is mocking Lord Hanuman and using insulting words for Lord Ram."

Alleged gang rape of foreign tourist

Prominent, privately-owned pro-government Hindi TV news channel, Zee News, on its show, "DNA" (at 21:20 IST or 15:50 GMT) reported about the alleged gang rape of a foreign tourist.

The anchor said, "In Indian culture, we have the tradition of treating the guest as God, which means that if a guest comes to our home, we should welcome them like we would welcome God… But the thinking of some people has been polluted so badly that instead of treating guests [of the country] as God, they don't even shy away from committing crimes against them."

The anchor added, "From the past four days, an incident which took place with a foreign guest is being discussed in the entire country… In [eastern state] Jharkhand's Dumka, eight men committed a gruesome crime like a gang rape with a Spanish travel blogger. Whenever an incident takes place with a foreign guest, it ruins India's image at the international level."

The anchor mentioned, "For this, our society and system are responsible at large. This incident has today put the society, system and officials in the witness box of questions… The travel blogger, along with her husband, had reached Dumka on Friday [1 March]. As it was dark by the time they reached, the couple decided to put up a tent and stay in the farms of the Kunji village there."

The anchor added, "As per the registered FIR [first information report, police complaint], two people on a bike reached there at 7 PM and called up a few more people to join them there. The accused persons assaulted the woman's husband and held them hostage in the tent. They also looted them. The rest of the accused took the Spanish woman outside the tent and raped her."

The anchor said, "Police got information about the incident at nearly 11 PM, after which the victim was taken to the hospital. In the hospital, the gang rape was confirmed and later, police registered the FIR against eight men on the complaint of the victim."

Source: BBC Monitoring in Hindi 6 Mar 24

title: Kremlin: Pope's call for Ukraine to negotiate 'understandable'
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Pope Francis' call for Ukraine to negotiate an end to the war with Russia has been welcomed by Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, who added that the pontiff's position was "understandable".
body:
Peskov had been asked at his 11 March press briefing to comment on Pope Francis' recent remark that Kyiv should have "the courage to raise the white flag" and enter talks with Moscow - a comment that has been criticised in Ukraine.

"In general, the point that he expressed, of course, is quite understandable. He spoke in favour of negotiations. You know that our president has repeatedly spoken about our readiness and openness to solve our problems through negotiations. And this is preferable," Peskov was quoted as saying by the Interfax news agency.

However, Peskov continued, Moscow does not expect Ukraine to act on the Pope's suggestion.

"You know, unfortunately, that both the Pope's statements and the repeated statements of other parties, including ours, have recently been met with absolutely firm rejection by the Kyiv regime, and they do not allow for the possibility of conducting any negotiations," Peskov said.

Source: Interfax news agency, Moscow, in Russian 0909 gmt 11 Mar 24

title: IS claims killing senior al-Qaeda commander in Mali
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Islamic State (IS) group has said it killed a senior al-Qaeda commander it captured in an ambush in Mali's north-eastern Gao region.
body:
IS published a photo purporting to show the captured figure,  named "Ilyas " (also spelled Iliassou, aka Amadou Moussa), before his death.

The group made the claim on 14 March in an "exclusive" report by its weekly newspaper al-Naba (issue 434). It came as part of a roundup of the activities of IS's Sahel branch. 

A privately-owned Malian newspaper reported on 12 March that the al-Qaeda commander was killed in clashes with IS in Intillit (also spelled N'Tillit) in Gao on 9 March.

IS said its ambush followed an al-Qaeda raid on "the village of Zorani in Gao, to the west of Niger River" on 6 March, in which militants stole money and cattle from residents "under the claim" that they supported IS.

Al-Naba said IS militants responded with an ambush to take revenge and retrieve the stolen items, but did not specify whether that happened on the same day or later.

It said IS militants set up an ambush near a village rendered as "Ousadia" in Ansongo, Gao, to target the al-Qaeda militants on their way back to their areas. 

The ambush, it said, prompted clashes that resulted in the killing of 16 al-Qaeda fighters, "while the rest fled".

Al-Naba said that it was during those clashes that IS militants captured four al-Qaeda members, including the senior al-Qaeda commander, and later killed them.

It said his name was "Ilyas" and that he was a "leading" al-Qaeda official in Gao who had "a track record of crimes against Muslims in general and the mujahidin [IS] in particular".

"After interrogating him, the mujahidin killed him, along with the other captured [al-Qaeda] members, using machine guns, and rid Muslims of his evil", al-Naba said.

To support its claim, al-Naba featured a photo (above) that it said showed Ilyas and the three other al-Qaeda fighters sitting on the ground with militants behind them ready to shoot. The faces of the captives were shown (blurred by BBC Monitoring) but the faces of the militants behind them was blurred by al-Naba. 

The IS newspaper said that the group's militants eventually retrieved the money allegedly stolen by the al-Qaeda raiders and "returned it to its owners" in the village.

Source: Telegram messaging service in Arabic on 14 Mar 24

title: Sudan army says 'technocrats' to run country until elections
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Sudan’s ruling Sovereign Council member Gen Ibrahim Jabir Ibrahim has said that the military would form “a technocratic government” to run the affairs of the country until elections are held, state-owned Sudan News Agency (Suna) has reported.
body:
Ibrahim made the remarks on 25 March while addressing the officers, non-commissioned officers and soldiers of the 2nd Infantry Division of the armed forces in the eastern city of Gedaref.

“Our clear message to the politicians is that there will be a non-political transitional period in which the country would be governed by a technocratic government that would manage the affairs of the Sudanese people and prepare for elections,” Ibrahim said.

He added that “the armed forces will not enter any agreement with politicians.”

Ibrahim's remarks came days after another Sovereign Council member, Lt Gen Yasir al-Atta, said the army would not cede power to civilian groups until after elections are held in the country.

But Gen Atta also urged pro-army activist groups to form a government to run the country in a move that would have excluded former civilian coalition the Forces of Freedom and Change (FFC), which shared power the army before the October 2021 coup.

The army accuses FFC of backing the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces but the group denies the allegation.

See: Briefing: Fears of state disintegration grow in Sudan as RSF hardens tone

Source: Suna news agency website, Khartoum, in Arabic 25 Mar 24

title: Saudi Arabia spearheads fresh extension to lowered oil output
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Saudi Arabia has extended its voluntary cuts to oil production until June, the official Saudi news agency SPA reported on 3 March, cited an unnamed source at the energy ministry for the news.
body:
The move is the latest extension to lowered output spearheaded by Saudi Arabia as well as Russia at Opec+, maintaining a cut of 1m barrels a day (bpm). As usual, multiple other countries followed suit.

Later reporting by SPA attributed the news to the Opec+ general secretariat, and added a list of other countries and the daily cuts they are maintaining, as: Iraq (220,000 bpm), United Arab Emirates (163,000 bpm), Kuwait (135,000 bpm), Kazakhstan (82,000 bpm), Algeria (51,000 bpm), Oman (42,000 bpm).

The cuts apply to the second quarter of 2024, SPA reported.

Saudi Arabia's decisions in tandem with Russia at Opec+ to cut oil production and maintain lowered levels of output since October 2022 have repeatedly sparked US ire, prompting Saudi media backlash against Washington in turn. 

See also: Explainer: How is oil giant Saudi Arabia talking up a greener future?

Energy minister says Saudi Arabia can raise or cut oil output 'at any time'

Source: SPA news agency, Riyadh, in Arabic 1555 GMT 3 Mar 24

title: Al-Shabab claims retaking village in central Somalia
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The militant group al-Shabab has claimed to have recaptured a village in the central Galgudud region without resistance following the withdrawal of the Somali government forces, the pro-militant Radio al-Furqan website has reported.
body:
"On the morning of 10 March, forces of al-Shabab mujahidin movement took the control of Masagawa village of Galgudud region where the federal government soldiers have fled," the website said.

"Upon taking control of the area, they killed one soldier and captured another alive," adding that they seized military supplies left behind by the government forces.

The seizure of Masagawa village comes a day after al-Shabab reclaimed the town of Amara after the withdrawal of government troops.

Somali army and al-Shabab fighters have clashed several times in the region with each of them claiming victory over the other.

Source: Radio Al-Furqaan website in Somali on 10 Mar 24

title: South Sudan distances itself from citizens captured in Sudan war
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The South Sudanese government has distanced itself from 14 of its citizens said to have been captured by the Sudanese army while fighting for the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF), privately owned broadcaster Radio Tamazuj reported on 18 March.
body:
On 15 March, the Sudanese military that has been at war with the RSF since April 2023 announced the capture of the South Sudanese “mercenaries” during an operation to retake the headquarters of state TV and radio in Omdurman city from the paramilitary force.

“For South Sudanese who happen to be there, it is not our duty. Of course, these people are not under our control and are people who might have decided to rebel against the government and fight with the other group or these are fortune seekers because these days you are paid to go and fight as a mercenary,” South Sudan’s Information Minister Michael Makuei was quoted as saying.

He ruled out the possibility that the alleged involvement of South Sudanese nationals in Sudan's war would lead to a diplomatic row between the neighbouring countries.

Sudan’s military has accused the RSF of hiring fighters from other parts of Africa to augment its ranks, an accusation the paramilitary force has denied.

Source: Radio Tamazuj website in English 18 Mar 24

title: Al-Qaeda claims deadly attack on Burkina Faso militia base
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Al-Qaeda in the Sahel has claimed that it killed 10 pro-government militia members during an attack in south-western Burkina Faso.

title: Turkey starts digging new gas exploration well in Black Sea - energy minister
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Energy Minister Alparslan Bayraktar has said the Turkish drillship "Fatih" has launched a new search for natural gas in the Black Sea.

title: Clan clashes reportedly kill 10 people in central Somalia
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

At least 10 people have been killed and dozens of others wounded after two rival clan militias clashed in central Somalia’s Mudug region, the privately-owned Radio Kulmiye has reported.

title: Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan warns of Sri Lanka-like situation after election 'lie'
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Pakistan's imprisoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan
body:
predicted a Sri Lanka-like political crisis in the country, blaming it on what he termed as a "theft of the mandate" in the 8 February general election, The Express Tribune newspaper reported on its website on 13 March.

"My all predictions [as received] have proven true," Khan said during an informal interaction with journalists in Rawalpindi's Adiala jail, during which he reiterated that he was not holding talks with the current government for any reconciliation.

"Each and everything is based on lies... the election was a lie... the security threat was also a lie," he added, emphasising that his party, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) was deliberately sidelined from the electoral arena.

Khan also vowed to continue peaceful protests against the alleged rigging in the elections and pursue a legal way through the Supreme Court, the report added.

Source: The Express Tribune website, Karachi, in English 0928 GMT 14 Mar 24

title: Ukraine says nine Russian strike drones destroyed
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Ukrainian air defences shot down nine out of 12 Shahed kamikaze drones Russia launched on the night 29-30 March, the Air Force Command has reported on Telegram.
body:
The drones were downed over Dnipropetrovsk, Kherson, Poltava, and Odesa regions, it said.

Russia also attacked Donetsk Region with four S-300/S-400 missiles, the command said. None of them were reported shot down.

Source: Telegram messaging service in Ukrainian 0516 GMT 30 Mar 24

title: BBCM Ukraine Watchlist 26 Aug 25
snippet:
Stories being covered today by BBC Monitoring from Ukrainian broadcast, press and social media sources

ONE PLUS ONE TV
body:
DAY 1,280 OF RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE

Zelensky, US envoy discuss Russia sanctions

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and US envoy Keith Kellogg yesterday discussed sanctions and tariff pressure on Russia, as well as other ways to force Moscow into peace negotiations, the United News TV marathon said this morning.

"President Zelensky once again confirmed that Ukraine is ready for the format of leaders, but stressed that Moscow must also be ready," the TV said.

They also discussed arms procurement, drones and the return of children abducted by Russia.

"Ukraine is deeply grateful to the United States for its support, and we value that President Trump @POTUS is so determined to achieve real peace," Zelensky said on X. "It is very important to realize all the results - political, defense, and economic - that were achieved during our meeting together with European leaders in Washington."

Ukraine expands on security guarantees

In a phone call with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and European colleagues, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Andriy Sybiha "reiterated Ukraine's position that security guarantees must be concrete, legally binding, and effective".

"They should be multidimensional, including military, diplomatic, legal, and other levels," he said on X. "We all share the conviction that the Ukrainian army is the fundamental level of any such guarantees, therefore its maximum strengthening is our top priority."

"Moscow must know that it cannot drag its feet forever. If Russia continues to reject meaningful, constructive steps toward peace, it must face consequences: severe increase in sanctions and strengthening for Ukraine's capabilities," he said.

Other diplomatic activity

Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store and Ukrainian Defence Minister Denys Shmyhal yesterday visited a drone manufacturer, the TV marathon reported this morning.

Shmyhal announced that Norway would provide $8.5bn to Ukraine in 2026, most of which would be spent on military equipment. He called on other partner countries to also invest in Ukraine's rapidly growing defence industry.

Norway also helps procure Patriot missile systems for Ukraine and provides military training, Shmyhal said.

The secretary of the National Security and Defence Council, Rustem Umerov, yesterday met UK Chief of Defence Staff Antony Radakin and "his successor" Richard Knighton, the TV marathon reported.

They discussed defence support and security guarantees for Ukraine as well as sanctions and political pressure on Russia.

Ukraine consulting Poland over Starlink funding

The Ukrainian Digital Transformation Ministry is in talks with Poland after President Karol Nawrocki yesterday vetoed a bill which provides financial support for unemployed Ukrainian citizens, including child benefits and public healthcare, the Ukrainian public broadcaster Suspilne has reported, quoting the ministry's press service.

Polish Deputy Prime Minister Krzysztof Gawkowski said on X that the veto de-facto ends Polish funding for the Starlink satellite systems for Ukraine.

"Karol Nawrocki's decision turns off the Internet in Ukraine," he said. "I can't imagine a better gift for Putin's troops than cutting off Ukraine from the Internet, which the President has just decided."

The head of the Polish president's office, Zbigniew Bogucki, however said Nawrocki's veto does not turn off Starlink for Ukraine, the PAP news agency quoted him as saying.

Nawrocki also said yesterday that he would table a bill banning the promotion of "Banderism", referring to the ideology of Ukrainian nationalist leader Stepan Bandera.

Both decisions triggered shock in Ukraine.

Journalist-turned-serviceman Taras Berezovets said on Telegram that Polish independence fighter Jozef Pilsudski would be ashamed of his descendants for passing the move on Starlink.

Ukrainian historian and former head of the Ukrainian National Remembrance Institute, Volodymyr Vyatrovych, said on Facebook that Nawrocki's remarks on "Bandera ideology" are "similar to Putin's, who refers to destruction of all things Ukrainian as de-Nazification".

Nationalist former MP Dmytro Yarosh, writing on Facebook, urged Nawrocki not to destroy Ukrainian-Polish "friendship" and not to take "Moscow's side".

War update

There were 174 armed clashes between Ukrainian and Russian troops yesterday, the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine said on Facebook this morning.

This includes 43 clashes in the Pokrovsk sector, which was the hottest on the front line.

Another 28 clashes were reported in the Lyman sector and 19 in the Novopavlivka sector, 13 in the Kramatorsk sector, 12 in the South Slobozhanshchyna (in Kharkiv Region) sector, eight in the Kupyansk sector, five in the North Slobozhanshchyna (in Sumy Region) and Kursk sectors, five in the Siversk sector, three in the Prydniprovskyy sector (in Kherson Region), two in the Orikhiv sector and one in the Hulyaypole sector.

title: Al-Qaeda in Sahel claims attack on Mali army post on Guinea border
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Al-Qaeda in the Sahel has claimed responsibility for an attack on a Malian checkpoint on the southern border with Guinea on 7 March.
body:
Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal-Muslimin (JNIM) issued the claim on 8 March via its channels on Telegram and Chirpwire.

The statement said JNIM militants raided the Kouremale border post in the Koulikoro region, seizing weapons and destroying vehicles.

It said that Malian security personnel fled the post, claiming no casualties.

The group published an image of weapons allegedly seized in the raid. 

Guinean media have reported that the authorities there have deployed additional troops to the border with Mali following the incident.

 The Malian military has said that the attack caused material damage to the post, without casualties reported.

The latest JNIM statement was numbered 103 for its "Masina" area of operation.

Last year, the group claimed an attack on a Malian checkpoint in the nearby town of Narina, close to the border with Guinea. 

See more: Guinea beefs up security at border with Mali after attack

Briefing: Al-Qaeda claims attacks against southern Mali checkpoints

Source: Telegram messaging service in Arabic 1800 GMT 8 Mar 24

title: Son of ex-Iranian official released after 'brief detention' in Sweden
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The son of Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian official who has been sentenced to life in prison in Sweden, has been released after a brief detention, the judiciary's Mizan News Agency reported on 31 March.
body:
Majid Nouri has been freed and handed over to the Iranian consulate, Mizan reported.  

In a post on X on 28 March, Atiyeh Nouri, wrote that her brother, Majid, has been arrested by Sweden's police while visiting his father in prison. In another post on 29 March, she wrote that her brother was detained for taking pictures.

Mizan added that efforts for the release of Hamid Nouri, who is detained on "fabricated charges by the hypocrites" would continue. The term, "hypocrites", is used by the establishment to refer to the exiled opposition group Mojahedin-e Khalq Organisation (MEK/MKO).

Nouri's family have launched a media campaign with the aim to get him released. 

Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian judiciary was convicted by the Swedish court in 2022 for his involvement in the torture and mass execution of political prisoners, particularly MEK members, in 1988.

Iranian authorities say Nouri’s imprisonment and trial in Sweden is "politically-motivated", noting that the case has been influenced by pressure and propaganda of anti-Iran groups and individuals living in the West.

Source: Mizan news agency, Tehran, in Persian 1431 GMT 31 Mar 24

title: Houthis claim new attack on US ship in Gulf of Aden
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The Houthi rebel movement’s military spokesman, Yahya Sarea, has said the group has targeted a "US ship" in the Gulf of Aden, in a live address aired on the group's Al-Masirah TV on 6 March, his third in four days.
body:
Sarea named the ship as "True Confidence" and said it was targeted using "a number of appropriate naval missiles" and that the attack "was precise [...] which led to a fire erupting [on the ship]".

He said that the operation "took place after the ship's crew refused to heed warning messages", adding that "the Yemeni armed forces reiterate their warnings to all ships to respond to the calls of the Yemeni armed forces, and that the crew of all targeted ships must evacuate them quickly after the first hit." The Houthis refer to their forces as the Yemeni military.

“Operations in the Red and Arabian Seas will not stop until the aggression ceases and the siege on the Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip is lifted,” he said.

In a statement posted on X earlier on 6 March, United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations (UKMTO) said it had “received a report of an incident 54 [nautical miles] southwest of Aden, Yemen“ adding that "a merchant vessel [...] has been hit and has suffered damage". 

"The vessel has been abandoned by the crew is no longer under command," it added.

In his previous address, delivered on 5 March, Sarea said the group had targeted two US warships in the Red Sea. In an earlier address on 4 March, he said the group had attacked an "Israeli ship MSC SKY" - a Swiss-owned container vessel - in the Arabian Sea hours after targeting US warships in the Red Sea.

See also: Houthis claim fresh attack on US warships in Red Sea

Briefing: Houthis claim attack on 'Israeli' ship in Arabian Sea, report US raids

Source: Al-Masirah TV, Beirut, in Arabic 1940 GMT 5 Mar 24

title: Turkey-backed Syrian rebel authority calls on militant factions to join SNA
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The Turkey-backed self-proclaimed government in northern Syria has released a statement calling on all militant factions in rebel-held areas to come under the authority of the Turkey-backed Syrian National Army (SNA).
body:
On 21 March, leading pro-opposition website Enab Baladi cited a statement issued by the Interim Government's Ministry of Defence, calling on groups that are not already affiliated with the SNA to join the ministry under the umbrella of the Turkey-backed coalition.

The statement added that all groups that refuse to join the SNA will be dealt with as an "outlaw group".

Enab Baladi notes that this statement had come following the resignation of Hussein Assaf (also known as Abu Tawfiq) as leader of the Al-Shahba Gathering, a group aligned with Syria-based militant group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS). 

According to the outlet, Assaf's resignation came soon after military tensions escalated in northern Syria as a result of the Turkish National Intelligence Organisation (MIT) chief's convoy being intercepted by members of the Al-Shahba Gathering in Syria's Aleppo, prompting SNA to dispatch forces to the scene.

See also: Syria rebels preview formation of new alliance of HTS allies, foes

Source: Enab Baladi, Istanbul, in Arabic 1013 GMT 21 Mar 24

title: Ukraine says 31 Russian strike drones destroyed
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Ukrainian air defences shot down 31 out of 34 Shahed kamikaze drones Russia launched on the night 22-23 March, the Air Force Command has reported on Telegram.
body:
The drones were downed over Dnipropetrovsk, Kherson, Mykolayiv, Poltava, and Zaporizhzhya regions, it said.

Russia also attacked Donetsk Region with four S-300 missiles, the command said. None of them were reported shot down.

Source: Telegram messaging service in Ukrainian 0603 GMT 23 Mar 24

title: Highlights from Maldives' Dhivehi-language press, websites 13 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a BBCM selection of major news items published in Maldives' Dhivehi-language press and online media outlets on 13 March 2024.

Sun.mv
body:
Election body allows ex-president's party to amend applications

The Election Commission on 12 January announced that 1,976 of the over 3,000 application forms, submitted to the commission by the People's National Front (PNF) to register the party, are valid. Commission vice-president Ismail Habeeb said the PNF had submitted 3,370 application forms, which the commission has verified, rejecting 81 forms, and allowing the party to further complete 1,313 forms on issues such as dates and other administrative issues. Former president Abdulla Yameen had resigned from the Progressive Party of Maldives (PPM) and People's National Congress (PNC) coalition right after the party's candidate (President Dr Mohamed Muizzu) was elected president, and commenced efforts to establish his new political party, the PNF. The Election Commission had given the go-ahead for the party to commence work to establish the party on 29 November. Former science minister Mohamed Maleeh Jamal, who was leading the party's membership drive, had at the time said the required 3,000 application forms would be submitted within 24 hours. Following delays till December, he had said the party was delaying the submission until Yameen was freed. Yameen is currently serving an 11-year prison sentence, issued on 25 December 2022, which he is currently serving under house arrest. [Online, Approximate Words: 240]

[This is a prominent Dhivehi-language news website that generally carries objective reporting. It is owned by the Sun Media Group, the largest private media house in the Maldives.]

Avas

Poll panel approves retirement benefits for members

The Election Commission has amended its regulations and approved a retirement package for members. The amendment, published in the government gazette on 28 February, states that an employee, after reaching 55 years of age, has the option to request to retire with benefits, and gives the commission to authority to instruct an employee to retire as well. Retirement benefits include a bulk payment at the outset, based on 15 years of service, as well as 75% of their monthly salaries at the time of retirement paid monthly for life. The regulation also allows for a current employee, who is appointed as a member of the commission, to be eligible for retirement benefits, if they have served the commission for a total of at least 10 years (as an employee and a commission member cumulatively). The retirement packages were formulated and introduced allowing for the five current members to also benefit from the retirement package. Current vice-president Ismail Habeeb's term at the commission will end on 13 March. [Online, Approximate Words: 340]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website run by "Mundoo" Adam Haleem and owned by former lawmaker Abdullah Sinan. The website is generally critical of the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party and Jumhooree Party.]

Mihaaru

Maldives aims to host ITB Berlin fair in 2026

Minister of Tourism Ibrahim Faisal on 12 March announced the government's objective of hosting the 2026 ITB Berlin fair. The minister, speaking to the press on the ITB fair held from 5 to 7 March, said the Maldives is the world's most popular tourist destination, and as such the government is aiming for the objective of hosting the world's biggest tourism fair. He added that the Maldives Marketing and Public Relations Corporation (MMPRC) will be holding discussions with stakeholders to make the necessary preparations and arrangements to do so in 2026. The Maldives had last hosted the ITB fair in 2016. The Maldives was represented at the 2024 fair by 214 delegates from 107 companies. [Online, Approximate Words: 220]

[Mihaaru is a Dhivehi-language daily that generally carries objective reporting and does not appear to favour any political party. The newspaper widely covers political developments, radicalisation, and counter-terrorism-related developments in the Maldives.]

Raajje.mv

Parliament approves counting total seats without vacant ones

The Maldivian parliament on 12 March voted against implementing a Supreme Court ruling on the constitutional case, where it stated that the number of seats in parliament must be counted including vacant seats. Opposition Member of Parliament for Villingili constituency Saud Hussain submitted a motion to parliament proposing that vacant seats not be counted in determining the total number of lawmakers in parliament and session quora. The motion was seconded by The Democrats' Member of Parliament Eva Abdulla, and the motion was passed with voted from 25 lawmakers for and two against. Speaker of Parliament Mohamed Aslam had, at the session on 12 March, initially proposed voting on revoking changes to parliament rules of procedure on the issue, in light of the Supreme Court verdict. [Online, Approximate Words: 180]

[This is the Dhivehi-language website of widely watched, privately-run television news channel Raajje TV that supports the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website provides detailed coverage of government actions and statements and sometimes criticises Chinese involvement in the Maldives.]

Vaguthu

Court orders incumbent lawmaker to pay decreed debt

The Civil Court on 29 February ordered incumbent Member of Parliament for Dhuvaafaru constituency, Ismail Ahmed, to settled 856,830 rufiyaa ($55,566) in outstanding payments to Ismail Haleel, a sub-contractor. The court, in its ruling, said Ahmed had entered a contract (in 2018) to construct three classrooms in Kandoodhoo School in Thaa Atoll and made a verbal agreement with Haleel to implement the project in 2018. The contract was valued at 1.2m rufiyaa ($84,306), of which Ahmed had paid 425,000 rufiyaa ($27,567). The Civil Court issued the ruling in absentia as Ahmed had failed to appear in court or responded to the court, after accepting the summons. Ahmed is currently campaigning for the upcoming parliament election in his current constituency, on a ticket from opposition Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP). Under the constitution, a decreed debt and failure to pay the debt will result in the lawmaker not meeting the conditions required to be a member of parliament. As such, if Ahmed fails to pay the outstanding within 15 days of the ruling, his seat may be at risk. [Online, Approximate Words: 180]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website that was founded by a youth group that favours the ruling Progressive Party of Maldives and People's National Congress and criticises politicians from the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website generally backs China and strongly criticises India.]

Channel News Maldives

Lawmaker responds to decreed debt verdict

Member of Parliament or Dhuvaafaru constituency Ismail Ahmed on 12 March filed a case at court requesting that a verdict against him to the outstanding on payments to a sub-contractor, be annulled. In a statement he issued, Ahmed said the Civil Court had previously overseen the same case, ruling in 2020 that there are no outstanding payments from him to Haleel (and as such the same case cannot be filed at the same court – double jeopardy). [Online, Approximate Words: 180]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website formerly known as Voice of Free Press run by prominent journalist Ismail Rasheed. It carried original reporting, editorial and commentaries primarily on domestic political and socio-economic issues and does not favour Indian or Chinese involvement in the country.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Dhivehi 13 Mar 24

title: Iran leader declares year of 'surge in production with people's participation'
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has announced the new 1403 year according to the Iranian solar calendar, which starts on 20 March this year, as the year of "surge in production through people's participation".
body:
Khamenei announced the new year slogan in his pre-recorded address aired by the state-run IRINN rolling news channel, as well as other channels, in the morning of 20 March, moments after the arrival of Nowruz which is marked at the exact moment of the vernal equinox.

He said the government "must pave the way for the people to get involved in production" and "remove the obstacles that stand in the way".

"There are great capacities in the public sector… these capacities must become active. They should be used for the benefit of the country and the people," Khamenei added.

The slogan announced by the supreme leader is a key policy guideline to be followed during the coming year. Khamenei usually announces the new year slogan in his annual Nowruz messages.

Source: Islamic Republic of Iran News Network (IRINN), Tehran, in Persian 0307 GMT 20 Mar 24

title: Iran navy gets new vessels, cruise missiles systems
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The navy of Iran's regular army has acquired new equipment, the armed forces-linked Tasnim news agency reported on 6 March.
body:
At a ceremony at the southern port city of Bandar Abbas, the navy received "42 modern" defence equipment and tech, including eight surface, sub-surface and hovercraft vessels and the Azarakhsh C14-class missile boats.

Several destroyers, drones, missiles, radar and air defence systems were also unveiled and added to the naval fleet.

Speaking at the ceremony, Army Commander-in-Chief Maj Gen Abdolrahim Mousavi warned "Iran's enemies and chief among them, America" of Iran's complete intelligence awareness in the region. He also accused the US of duplicity and "causing insecurity".

Source: Tasnim news agency website, Tehran, in Persian 0454 GMT 6 Mar 24

title: N Korea officials visit Russia embassy to offer condolences over Moscow attack
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Senior North Korean officials visited the Russian Embassy in Pyongyang on 26 March to offer condolences over the recent "large-scale terrorist attack" at a Moscow concert hall, the official Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) reported.
body:
Five leading officials from the ruling Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the defence and foreign ministries paid a condolence visit to the embassy, according KCNA.

They "expressed deep condolences to the bereaved families and victims, saying that the Korean people share sorrow with the Russian people at this moment," KCNA said, adding that they also voiced North Korea's "consistent stand against all sorts of terrorism".

Earlier, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un sent a message of condolence to Russian President Vladimir Putin over the shooting, expressing his "deep condolences and sympathy" to the victims and their bereaved families.

Source: KCNA website, Pyongyang, in English 0400 GMT 26 Mar 24

title: Senegal to hold elections on 24 March
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

President Macky Sall on 6 March set the date for the presidential election for 24 March, French public broadcaster RFI reported on 7 March.
body:
His decision came after the Constitutional Council rejected the 2 June date proposed by the National Dialogue team.

"Referred to by President Macky Sall for an opinion, the wise men reminded that the head of state’s mandate would end on 2 April and it was therefore not possible for him to organise an election after this date," the report said.

RFI further reported that the list of the 19 presidential candidates would remain the same. 

Sall on 3 February postponed the presidential elections originally scheduled for 25 February, a decision which was later revoked by the Constitutional Council on 15 February.

Source: Radio France Internationale website, Paris, in French 7 Mar 24

title: Uzbek capital police urge vigilance after Moscow attack
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The city police department in the Uzbek capital Tashkent has called on residents and visitors of the city to be vigilant and report anything suspicious, privately-owned news website Nova24.uz reported on 24 March.
body:
The police statement came a day after a deadly gunmen attack on the Crocus City Hall near Moscow, the report noted.

According to reports, at least 137 people were killed and over 150 others injured in the  22 March attack.

"The city police department has reminded the people of the need to be vigilant and urged them to report suspicious bags, boxes and other things left unattended," the report said.

"If suspicious items are found, it is necessary to immediately report to the nearest law enforcement officer or call 102," it added.

Source: Nova24.uz website, Tashkent, in Russian 1711 GMT 24 Mar 24

title: Russia: Transport aeroplane crashes in Ivanovo Region - reports
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

A cargo airplane has crashed in Russia's Ivanovo Region, according to unofficial reports on Telegram.
body:
Citing "preliminary information", Russian breaking news Telegram channel 112 reported that an Il-76 "military" plane crashed, near the Severny airfield.

In a post with two purported clips of the incident attached, the channel said the aircraft failed to reach the airfield and crashed in a nearby area.

A similar clip was also posted by breaking news Telegram channel SHOT, which said that eyewitnesses had reported seeing "an emergency landing of a plane in Ivanovo Region" at around 12:40 in the area of the Bogorodskoye cemetery.

Source: Telegram messaging service in Russian 1040 gmt 12 Mar 24

title: Highlights from press, websites in Indian-administered Kashmir 8 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a selection of major news items from select Urdu, English and Kashmiri-language press and online media sources in Indian-administered Kashmir on 8 March 2024.

Kashmir Uzma
body:
PM Modi says 'my mission to win hearts' of Kashmiris

Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 7 March said Jammu and Kashmir is the "crown" of the country, and it is "my mission to win the hearts" of the people of Kashmir. Prime Minister Modi was on a one-day visit to Kashmir. Addressing a grand public rally under the "Viksit Bharat Programme" at Bakshi Stadium in Srinagar, Prime Minister Modi said, "Seeing the crowds today at the rally venue, it appears that I have succeeded in winning the hearts of Kashmiris. I will leave no stone unturned to return the love I got here form the people of Kashmir." Criticising the Congress party and other political parties in Kashmir, the prime minister said, "Article 370 had always benefitted these parties and not the common man, and now after its abrogation, the dreams of the people are coming true." PM Modi said Jammu and Kashmir is being promoted as the most sought-after destination for wedding tourism and "I have been personally campaigning for it". He said in 2023, more than 20 million tourists visited Kashmir and there had also been an increase in the number of foreign travellers visiting Kashmir. [Words: 650]

[Urdu-language Kashmir Uzma is a pro-Kashmiri separatist newspaper that is strongly critical of the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Indian armed forces. The daily prominently publishes statements by militant leaders and favours talks with separatist leaders and Pakistan for the resolution of India-Pakistan dispute on Kashmir.]

Tameel-I-Irshad

LG Sinha says PM Modi made Kashmir 'bastion of peace'

Manoj Sinha, Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir, on 7 March credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi for establishing "permanent peace" in Kashmir after decades of turmoil. Addressing a large gathering at Bakshi Stadium in Srinagar, in the presence of Prime Minister Modi, Sinha said Kashmir, "once plagued by separatism and terrorism, has once again become a bastion of peace". Sinha roared from the stage, "It was only because of Prime Minister Modi's personal efforts that Kashmir has transformed into a bastion of peace, which has been known as the land of mystics and holy men." [Online, Approximate Words: 150]

[Urdu-language Tameel-I-Irshad is a pro-Kashmir separatist daily that focuses on local issues in Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours India-Pakistan talks for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Daily Chattan

Editorial discusses excitement over PM Modi's visit

An 8 March editorial said extreme excitement and enthusiasm was witnessed during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 7 March visit to Kashmir. The editorial said: "On the arrival of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Srinagar, people were observed to be very excited. People were seen heading towards Bakshi Stadium in large numbers early in the morning, where the prime minister addressed a large gathering of people. This was PM Modi's first visit to Kashmir after the abrogation of the special status to Jammu and Kashmir under Article 370 of the Indian constitution, in August 2019. On this occasion, people from all corners of Kashmir gathered at Bakshi Stadium to listen to his speech. A large number of people from every class and every region participated in the prime minister's rally. People from far-flung areas, such as Kupwara and Uri, reached here early in the morning to participate in the rally. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) members were happy to see such a large gathering. In his speech, Modi expressed his gratitude for the huge turnout and hoped that the party would get huge support from here. Modi said he was told that over 100,000 people belonging to different blocs have joined the BJP in the past few days, which was very encouraging. He said after becoming the prime minister, he tried to win the hearts of the people of Jammu and Kashmir and that after today's meeting, he feels that he has succeeded in this mission. He said after three decades, the era of bloodshed had ended in Kashmir and today there was an atmosphere of peace everywhere." [Online, Approximate Words: 750]

[Urdu-language Daily Chattan is a pro-Kashmir separatist, pro-militant daily that is popular in the northern part of Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours talks with Pakistan for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Daily Aftab

Editorial says PM Modi 'gifted' development projects to Kashmir

An 8 March editorial said Prime Minister Narendra Modi has "always been a source of satisfaction" for Jammu and Kashmir. This is because every time he came to Kashmir, he left some kind of gift for the Kashmiris. The editorial said: "Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while addressing the public at Bakshi Stadium on 7 March, said he is happy that he is speaking from his heart among his people today. Earlier, people belonging to every school of thought were seen going towards the Bakshi Stadium from early morning to listen to the prime minister's address and within half an hour, the entire stadium was full. So many people have not been seen in the stadium until today and the people who came in droves from villages and towns said they wanted to get a seat in the stadium. Prime Minister Modi's speech was full of emotion, especially when the people clapped loudly. On this occasion, the entire atmosphere was filled with applause and the faces of people around were joyful. Prime Minister Modi inaugurated the Holistic Agriculture Development Program and the project of construction and development of the Dargah Hazratbal shrine, besides scores of other important development projects for the region. He also distributed appointment orders among the unemployed youth and also emphasised that the youth should become job providers and not job seekers. That is why his visit is always a source of satisfaction for Kashmiris, because every time he comes here, he left some kind of gift to the Kashmiris. Even today, he did not leave empty-handed; he handed gifts to Kashmiris through development projects, which will benefit the common man." [Online, Approximate Words: 500]

[Urdu-language Daily Aftab is a pro-separatist daily that focuses on local issues of Kashmir valley. The daily is critical of the state and the federal government, and favours talks with separatists and Pakistan for the resolution of India-Pakistan dispute over Kashmir.]

Srinagar Times

Large number of social activists join People's Conference

A large number of socio-political activists on 7 March officially joined People's Conference (PC) in the Nathipora area of Rafiabad in north Kashmir, hailing the party's vision and development agenda. The joining ceremony was presided by PC senior vice-president Abdul Gani Vakil, who warmly welcomed the new members, praising their decision to join the party, which he said truly represents the hopes and aspirations of the people of Jammu and Kashmir. He emphasized the party's inclusive vision and unwavering dedication to serving the interests of the region's populace. He also urged the members to pace up the public outreach programmes and apprise them about the party's agenda and vision that is based on development and equal opportunities for all. The new members pledged to uphold the party's ideals and work diligently for the welfare of the public and the grassroots growth of the party.  [Online, Approximate Words: 200]

[Urdu-language Srinagar Times is a pro-Kashmir separatist, pro-militant daily that focusses on local issues in Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours talks with Pakistan for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Urdu and Kashmiri 8 Mar 24

title: Highlights from India's Marathi-language press, websites 22 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a BBCM selection of major news items from select Indian Marathi-language press and online media outlets 22 March 2024.

Lokmat
body:
Party declares seven election candidates from western state

Congress party on 21 March declared its third list of 57 candidates for Lok Sabha (lower house of parliament) elections, including seven from western state Maharashtra. Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj (descendant of 17th century Maratha ruler Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj) will contest from Kolhapur (western city) while former Member of Legislative Assembly (MLA), Praniti Shinde, has been fielded from Solapur (western city) seat. MLA Ravindra Dhangekar will contest election from Pune (western city), who had won by-election (special election) for Kasba Peth assembly seat of city in March 2023, a seat held by Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) since 1995. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 150]

Editorial on top court strictures against probe agency

"It is true that investigation of financial crimes is intricate. Therefore, it is not necessary that probe will be completed in three months. However, now the ED (federal agency Enforcement Directorate) will have to think about arresting suspects only after it gets a grip on investigation, instead of doing so at the start of probe. If supplementary charge sheets (official police complaint) are restricted, then cases of dropping and adding the names of accused as one wished will come down. In short, it will bring some order to the efforts of checking financial crimes. Of course, only if the ED takes the strictures of the top Court seriously." [Supreme Court on 20 March, while hearing the default bail plea of Prem Prakash, an alleged associate of former Chief Minister of eastern state Jharkhand, Hemant Soren, warned the ED that it cannot arrest a person without probe in the case being complete and keep on filing supplementary charge sheets to keep them in prison.] [Page: 6, Approximate Words: 500]

[Lokmat is a popular Marathi-language daily edited by Vijay Darda, a Congress party member. The paper is mostly critical of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) government especially on its handling of Kashmir, terrorism and economic issues.]

Maharashtra Times

News report notes opposition to entry of party into bloc

Induction of Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) is reportedly being seen as certain after meeting of party's chief with Federal Home Minister, Amit Shah, took place. However, workers and office bearers of Bharatiya Janta Party (BJP) and Shiv Sena (Chief Minister Eknath Shinde), especially in Mumbai (western city), have reportedly opposed it. They have reportedly demanded that in the event MNS is allotted any election seat, the party should contest it on the election symbol of BJP or Shiv Sena and that they would not contest for railway engine (election symbol of MNS). [Online, Approximate Words: 100]

[Maharashtra Times is a Marathi-language daily from the influential Times of India media group. The daily is observed to be critical of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government on its handling of the economic issues and alleged suppression of dissent. However, it backs the government on national security issues.]

Loksatta

Chief Minister Shinde reassures party on seat sharing

Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on 21 March chaired a meeting of Shiv Sena Members of Parliament (MP), MLAs and other politicians, assuring them that they need not worry about seat sharing for Lok Sabha elections. The chief minister made an appeal to workers to work for getting as much parliamentarians of Mahayuti [coalition comprising of BJP, Shiv Sena and Nationalist Congress Party (NCP, Ajit Pawar)] elected because Lok Sabha elections will turn out to be a "progress report" of each MLA. [Page: 4, Approximate Words: 130]

Party rejects proposal of three seats for elections

Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi (VBA) on 21 March clarified that it had rejected the proposal of three Lok Sabha seats by Maha Vikas Aghadi [MVA, coalition mainly comprising Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray party, NCP-Sharadchandra Pawar party and Congress party] while Thackery faction MP, Sanjay Raut, also reportedly raised doubts regarding agreement between MVA and VBA. In 2019 Lok Sabha elections, Congress party and NCP had reportedly faced defeat on various seats due to vote division caused by VBA and therefore, there are efforts to accommodate the party in MVA. [Page: 4, Approximate Words: 180]

[Loksatta is the third largest-circulation Marathi-language daily, which is run by the Indian Express Group that owns respected English-language daily The Indian Express. The daily generally carries objective reporting on local Maharashtra and regional issues.]

Sakal

Politician seeks security for party members

Supriya Sule, working President of NCP-Sharadchandra Pawar party, has written to Pune Police demanding adequate security for MLAs Rohit Pawar and Yugendra Pawar. Sule has written that both politicians are campaigning for the upcoming elections and at some places there have been incidents of encircling Yugendra Pawar, which is "unconstitutional". Raising questions over their security, he asked that the police should provide them proper security. [Online, Approximate Words: 180]

[Sakal is the largest-circulation Marathi-language daily run by the family of Sharad Pawar, chief of the Maharashtra-based Nationalist Congress Party (NCP). The paper expectedly backs the NCP and often criticises its opposition parties.]

Pudhari

Party likely to finalise list for election seats

Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has reportedly sent a list of 13 candidates of Shiv Sena to New Delhi (national capital) for Lok Sabha elections, indicating that party will contest for as many seats for Lok Sabha. All the names in the list are of present MPs of the party. The BJP has reportedly assented to 10 names, therefore, three names are likely to change. Meanwhile, the BJP has declared its candidates on 20 out of total 48 seats of Maharashtra. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 150]

News report sees 'setback' in declaration of candidate 

Uddhav Thackeray on 21 March declared in Miraj [town in Sangli district] that Chandrahar Patil will be the party candidate for Sangli Lok Sabha seat. This is reportedly a "setback" for its MVA partner, Congress party, which had resolved to contest from the constituency. Making the announcement at a public meeting, Thackeray said that the crowd signaled that wrestler, Chandrahar Patil, will win. [Page: 2, Approximate Words: 200]

[Pudhari is the second-largest Marathi-language daily that is nationalist and right-of-centre. The daily backs the Indian government on issues such as national security, terrorism and Kashmir.]

Saamana

News report notes dissidence in party over candidature

There is reportedly an "infighting" in BJP over Lok Sabha candidature and loyal workers of the party are "upset" and "angry". These dissidents on 21 March visited the official residence of Deputy Chief Minister, Devendra Fadnavis, and the politician reportedly had a "hard time" in placating them. The discontent reportedly relates to granting candidature to politicians, who had come from outside, by ignoring original workers of the party. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 350]

Plea against politician for allegedly plotting riots

A division bench of Bombay High Court on 21 March reportedly took serious cognisance of a criminal writ petition. The petition is seeking directions to police for filing cases against BJP MLAs Nitesh Rane, Gita Jain and T Raja for allegedly making "provocative" remarks creating religious enmity. The petition claims that the police violated directions of the Supreme Court in 2022 and 2023, directing police not to wait for complaints from citizens in the event of provocative speeches, by not filing cases against the politicians. The high court has scheduled the hearing on the plea for 27 March. [Page: 3, Approximate Words: 250]

[Saamana is the mouthpiece of the Maharashtra-based political party Shiv Sena. This nationalist and right-leaning daily supports the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) government on national security, terrorism and Kashmir issues. However, it is very critical of the government on economy and unemployment issues.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Marathi 0000 GMT 22 Mar 24

title: President says Gaza war 'most urgent issue' for Iran, Muslim world
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has called the Israel-Gaza war the "most urgent topic for Iran and the Islamic world", in a address to a gathering of officials in Tehran, aired live by the state broadcaster's IRINN2 news channel.
body:
The war "inflicts pain on hearts across the world over injustice, lack of action and lack of attention towards the cries of children, women, men and the oppressed people who stand firm", Raisi said.

Raisi added that the "blood of martyred Palestinians and Gazans", as well as the resistance of the forces fighting there, would eventually replace the existing "unfair world order" with a "fair" one in a very near future.

Elsewhere in his speech, the president praised the country's "economic growth" and the curbing of inflation, which he said needed further consolidation.

He also called on officials to facilitate the implementation of the slogan of the new Iranian calendar year (starting on 20 March), which Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei declared to be the year of a "surge in production with the people's participation".

Source: Islamic Republic of Iran News Network 2 TV (IRINN 2), Tehran, in Persian 0727 GMT 25 Mar 24

title: Algeria to support Mozambique in fight against militants
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Algeria has pledged to support Mozambique in the fight against the militants operating in the northern Cabo Delgado Province, state-owned AIM reported on 4 March.
body:
In a press conference marking the end of his official visit to Algeria, President Filipe Nyusi revealed that the government, led by President Abdelmadjid Tebboune, would assist Mozambique with training and military equipment.

The local force, a self-defence militia comprising veterans of the national liberation war and community volunteers, will be among the beneficiaries of the military equipment, said the report.

"We hope that this equipment will arrive within a short time," Nyusi said, adding that the Algerian authorities "were touched when they heard that some war veterans were fighting terrorism underequipped".

The announcement comes amid a spike in militant activity in Cabo Delgado Province, which local media have linked to the "kill them wherever you find them" campaign launched by the so-called Islamic State group in January.

Source: Agencia Informacao Mocambique website, Maputo, in Portuguese 4 Mar 24

title: Iran leader meets outgoing convocation of leadership watchdog
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has held his last meeting with the members of the fifth convocation of Iran's clerical leadership watchdog, the Assembly of Experts.
body:
Iran held the national vote on 1 March to elect the new members for the sixth convocation of the 88-member watchdog body with an eight-year mandate, simultaneously with the parliamentary elections.

Khamenei described the assembly's responsibilities of electing the supreme leader and ensuring that he maintains his qualifications as "the most important management task in the Islamic Republic", according to a readout of his remarks published on his official website on 7 March.

He urged the clerical council not to neglect the principles of the Islamic Republic in its decisions, listing those principles as "establishing justice, fighting corruption and raising the level of Islamic knowledge and practice in the society".

Khamenei once again praised "Iranians' enthusiasm" in the elections and described it as a "sign of democracy" in Iran. 

The 1 March elections were marked by the 41% turnout, the lowest in the Islamic Republic history. The authorities have nonetheless hailed the elections as a success against a "propaganda campaign of the enemies".

The supreme leader also praised the new convocation of the Iranian parliament, saying that it was an "asset" for the parliament to have a combination of young and experienced MPs.

Many have accused the establishment of engineering the elections as most reformist and moderate candidates were disqualified from running in both elections by Iran's hardline vetting body, the Guardian Council. The Guardian Council members are directly or indirectly appointed by Khamenei.

Source: Leader.ir, Tehran, in Persian 1000 GMT 7 Mar 24

title: Iraq, Jordan electricity link starts operation
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The first phase of the electricity grid interconnection between Iraq and Jordan starts operating on 30 March, with a capacity of 40 megawatts.
body:
The state-run Iraqia News TV reported that the length of the interconnection line is 330 kilometres inside Iraqi territories, in addition to 6 kilometres inside Jordan.

On 29 March, Iraqi Electricity Minister Ziyad Ali Fadhel tweeted on X that Al-Rutba city in western Al Anbar province will be the first to receive electricity after "10 years of suffering" due to repeated power outages.

Fadhel added that in the second phase, 150 megawatts will be exported from Jordan and the amount will reach 500 megawatts in the future to feed large parts of Anbar. 

Iraq continues to grapple with crippling power shortages, particularly during the summer, which has been exacerbated by years of conflict and corruption since the US-led invasion in 2003.

Iraq heavily relies on Iran for its electricity needs. On 27 March, the country signed a five-year gas deal with Iran which will see Tehran supply the country with natural gas in order to generate electricity.

In 2020, Iraq announced that it would be linking electricity grids with Jordan and Egypt within a few years.

See also: Egypt, Iraq, Jordan discuss political, economic cooperation

Source: Iraqia News TV, Baghdad, in Arabic 0913 GMT 30 Mar 24

title: Yemen minister says Rubymar owner did not act to avert environmental catastrophe
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Yemen's Minister of Water and Environment Tawfiq al-Sharjabi has said that the owner of a ship which sank in the Red Sea after it was attacked by the Houthi rebels did not take the necessary measures to save the vessel and avert an environmental catastrophe, the government-run Saba news agency reported on 13 March.
body:
It said that the minister made the remarks during a virtual meeting of a crisis cell formed by the internationally recognised government with the representatives of a number of countries, the owner of the British-registered, Belize-flagged Rubymar and stakeholders, to discuss the situation of the sunken vessel, which experts have warned poses serious environmental risks due to fuel leakages and the thousands of tonnes of fertiliser on board.

Sharjabi said that the ship's owner had not acted to save the vessel despite the cooperation and facilities provided by the government, and stressed the need for each part to assume its responsibilities to avoid an environmental disaster.

See also: Yemen government warns of environmental catastrophe after Rubymar sinks

Source: Saba news agency website in Arabic 1206 GMT 13 Mar 24

title: South Sudan's Machar backs dialogue to resolve election row
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

South Sudan's First Vice President, who is also the leader of the country's largest armed opposition group, Riek Machar, has backed a call by a peace monitoring body on all parties to engage in dialogue to resolve the impasse over the conduct of the upcoming elections in December, the private Eye Radio website reported on 19 March.
body:
"First Vice-President Riek Machar has agreed to the R-JMEC proposal for peace parties to engage in dialogue to reach a consensus on the possibility of holding elections as scheduled in December 2024," the website said.

"Machar was responding to the Revitalised Joint Monitoring and Evaluation Commission's 15th March letter to him about the critical issues affecting the implementation of the peace deal," it added.

R-JMEC is a body tasked with monitoring the implementation of the 2018 peace agreement.

Machar's party has threatened to boycott the December elections, saying key provisions of the 2018 peace deal are yet to be implemented, while the government insists the polls would go ahead.

Source: Eye Radio, Juba, in English, 19 Mar 24

title: Iran court endorses death penalty for police officer for killing protester
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

An Iranian court has endorsed the death penalty for a local police chief found guilty of killing a man in a street gathering in the northern town of Bandar Anzali after the Iran-US football match in the 2022 Qatar World Cup.
body:
The reformist Sharq daily said on 27 March that a military court in Qazvin province approved the penalty that had been issued by a court in Gilan, a province in the north of Iran, where the local police chief Col Jafar Javanmardi shot Mehran Sammak dead in 2022.

Sharq quoted Majid Ahmadi, the lawyer for Sammak's family, as saying that the Qazvin court reinvestigated the case and endorsed the sentence issued by the Gilan court.

He added the convict now faces "qisas" - a judicial retribution penalty in the Iranian penal system - which carries the death penalty in murder cases, unless the victim's family agree to pardon him.

On 15 January, following the defendant's appeal, the Supreme Court overturned the death sentence, tasking the Qazvin court to study the case and issue a final verdict.

Sammak died of pellet gun wounds during celebrations on 30 November following the defeat of Iran's national team in the football match against the US, where some people engaged in street celebrations, mocking the establishment in the aftermath of Mahsa Amini protests.

Iran has rarely punished security forces members in the cases of killing or wounding citizens or protesters.

Source: Sharq, Tehran, in Persian 1300 gmt 27 Mar 24

title: Sri Lankan PM thanks China for assistance provided during economic crisis
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Sri Lanka and China signed nine agreements during Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena's visit to Beijing, the Daily Mirror newspaper website reported without providing details of the pacts.
body:
Gunawardena met President Xi Jinping and Chinese Premier Li Qiang on 27 March and discussed ways to increase bilateral cooperation.

During his discussions with Xi, the two leaders agreed to continue friendship based on peace and mutual respect without interfering in internal affairs, The Island newspaper website reported.

Xi offered support to Sri Lanka’s efforts for political and socio-economic progress, emphasising that China would always support safeguarding the independence, territorial integrity and sovereignty of Sri Lanka, the report added.

Gunawardena thanked Xi for the assistance provided by Beijing during Sri Lanka’s economic crisis and for extending debt restructuring facilities, it added.

Source: The Island website, Colombo, in English 0030 GMT 28 Mar 24

title: Al-Shabab claims killing two Kenyan soldiers in Lamu attack
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Fighters from the Somalia-based al-Shabab militant have killed two Kenyan soldiers and wounded three others during an attack in the coastal county of Lamu, jihadist-run Calamada website reported on 21 March.
body:
“Mujahidin forces fighting in Muslim lands occupied by Kenya have launched a direct attack on Kenyan crusaders’ base in Ishakani area of Lamu County, colonised by the Nairobi regime,” Calamada website said.

The attack also destroyed a vehicle and three tents belonging to the Kenyan forces, the report said. It did not say when the attack happened.

The group has been claiming an increasing number of attacks Kenyan territories bordering Somalia.

On 20 March, al-Shabab similarly claimed to have killed six Kenyan soldiers in a bomb attack between Shangani town and Kamboni village in Lamu. It said the attack had happened “a few days ago”.

On 17 March, the group claimed to have killed eight Kenyan soldiers and a Christian preacher in eastern Garissa County.

Source: Calamada website in Somali 21 Mar 24

title: N Korean leader sends condolences to Putin over Moscow concert hall attack
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has sent a message of condolence to Russian President Vladimir Putin following a deadly shooting at a concert venue in Moscow, the official Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) reported.

title: Pakistan paper seeks 'proactive' steps to keep food prices stable during Ramadan
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

An editorial in English-language newspaper Pakistan Observer has expressed concern over the hike in food prices and called for 'proactive measures' to keep prices stable during the Ramadan in Pakistan.
body:
Pakistan Observer is a prominent English-language daily and generally takes a pro-military stance.

"As the holy month of Ramazan [also known as Ramadan] begins, people are bracing themselves for customary extra hike in food prices - over and above the two-digit inflationary spiral that the country has been facing for almost four years," it said.

"It is disheartening to witness how essential kitchen items such as vegetables, fruits, sugar, edible oil, ghee, meat, eggs and pulses are subjected to substantial price hikes by unscrupulous traders, further exacerbating the economic hardships faced by many. Also unbridled export of meat and vegetables has further strained domestic prices," it added.

According to the paper the "the recent surge in prices, averaging at 31.5%, with some items witnessing up to a staggering 60% increase, is not justifiable, especially during a month that emphasizes compassion and communal care."

Comparing Pakistan to other countries, the editorial highlighted that  in "several European nations, efforts are made to reduce the prices of essential items during Ramazan, recognising the significance of this month to Muslim communities. However, in our country, instead of easing burden on consumers, traders and retailers exploit this period to maximise their profits, disregarding the principles of fairness and empathy."

Calling for government action, the editorial said that "it is important for both federal and provincial governments to take proactive measures to ensure stable prices during Ramazan."

Also calling for stringer measures, the paper added that "price control committees must be fully activated and empowered to crack down on profiteers who seek to exploit this month for personal gain. Strict enforcement of regulations and penalties for price manipulation are essential to deter such unethical practices."

It also called upon provincial governments to "ensure sale of quality items at special Ramazan bazaars". 

"Traders and retailers must recognise the sanctity of this time and exercise caution in their business practices. Instead of exploiting the heightened demand for essential items, they should embrace the principles of empathy and fairness, ensuring that consumers are not burdened unjustly," it added.

Source: Pakistan Observer website, Islamabad, in English 0000 GMT 11 Mar 24

title: Mexico ruling tells president to remove video of interview 'favouring candidate'
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Mexico's National Electoral Institute ordered left-wing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador to remove from his social media accounts and from the webpage of the Mexican presidency the video recording of a media interview in which he spoke supportively of Claudia Sheinbaum, presidential candidate for the governing Morena party, Mexican news site Animal Politico reported on 14 March.
body:
The electoral authority found that the interview violated impartiality rules for the upcoming June 2 presidential election and gave Lopez Obrador "six hours to edit or remove" the interview from his social media accounts. Lopez Obrador was quoted by Animal Politico as saying that the order from the electoral agency amounted to "censorship" against him.

According to opinion polls, Sheinbaum is leading the presidential race against centre-right candidate Xochitl Galvez. Lopez Obrador himself is constitutionally-barred from seeking reelection.

According to Animal Politico, Lopez Obrador had given the interview to Spain-based left-leaning media network Canal Red.
