Ukraine's air defences shot down or suppressed 46 out of 68 Russian drones during an overnight attack on 28-29 August, the Air Force has reported on Facebook.

Shahed-type and decoy drones were neutralised over northern and eastern regions of the country.

The Air Force said that 22 strike drones hit targets across nine locations in Donetsk and Dnipropetrovsk regions.

Two civilians were injured as a result of the Russian drone attack, Dnipropetrovsk regional governor Serhiy Lysak said on Telegram.

War update

There were 191 combat engagements between Ukrainian and Russian troops on 28 August, the Ukrainian General Staff reported on Facebook the following morning.

The Pokrovsk sector was the hottest spot on the front line in Ukraine, with 37 Russian attacks reported there.

Thirty-one clashes were reported in in the Lyman sector, 15 the Novopavlivka sector, 10 in the Siversk sector, eight in the Northern Slobozhanshchyna sector (covers parts of Sumy Region) and the Kursk sector, five in the Toretsk sector, five in the Kupyansk sector, four in the Kramatorsk sector, three in Kherson Region, two in the Southern Slobozhanshchyna sector (covers parts of Kharkiv Region) and one in the Orikhiv sector.

Russia carried out three missile and 70 air strikes using 36 missiles and 117 glide bombs, and shelled Ukraine 5,358 times, including 102 times with MRLS. Russian forces also used over 6,205 kamikaze drones.

Ukrainian aviation, rocket and artillery troops hit four Russian clusters of personnel and materiel, three artillery pieces, a command post and a "another important enemy facility", the General Staff added.

title: Al-Qaida claims deadly attack on police in central Mali
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Al-Qaeda in the Sahel has claimed to have killed three members of the Malian police force in an attack in the city of Mopti in central Mali.

title: Kazakh, Azerbaijani leaders welcome first train from China
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Kazakhstan's President Kasym-Zhomart Tokayev and his Azerbaijani counterpart Ilham Aliyev have taken part via video link in a ceremony to welcome a train from China to the South Caucasus country, the Central Asian president's official website reported on 11 March.
body:
"Kasym-Zhomart Tokayev and Ilham Aliyev took part via teleconference in a ceremony marking the arrival of a container train from the new Kazakh-Chinese transport and logistics centre in Xi'an to Apsheron station (in Azerbaijan) on the route of the Trans-Caspian International Transport Route," the report said.

Quoting Tokayev the report said that the train was a sign of a new transport system in Eurasia that was taking shape against the backdrop of "global geopolitical turbulence". It added that Tokayev believes that his country and Azerbaijan are playing a key role in the development.

For his part, Aliyev congratulated those involved in the project for making it happen and said that "Kazakhstan and Azerbaijan are actively working to strengthen cooperation in many areas, including transit and transport".

On 28 February, Kazakhstan opened its first freight terminal in X'ian and launched a train along the Kazakhstan-China-Azerbaijan route.

Source: President.kz, Astana, in Russian and Kazakh 11 Mar 24

title: Yemeni fishermen held in Eritrea released - website
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Eleven Yemeni fishermen held in Eritrea for around two weeks have been released, according to Al-Masdar Online website.
body:
A report by the Yemeni media outlet on 9 March quoted local sources as telling it that the fishermen - from the Mokha and Al Khawkhah districts in the Red Sea coastal province of Hudaydah - had arrived earlier on the same day in Mokha.

The Eritrean authorities released the fishermen after holding them and confiscating their boats and equipment at the end of February, the sources said.

They added that the fishermen had returned without their boats and equipment.

"Yemeni fishermen face multiple and continued violations from the Houthi group on the one hand and Eritrea on the other hand," Al-Masdar said.

It added that the ongoing Houthi attacks on ships in the Red Sea had "worsened the suffering of fishermen and threatened their livelihoods".

See also: Yemen website says fisherman killed in suspected US strikes

Yemen rebel media report return of fishermen detained in Eritrea

Source: Al-Masdar Online website in Arabic 1742 GMT 9 Mar 24

title: Iran signs 'unprecedented' oil deals with domestic firms
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Iranian Oil Minister Javad Owji has announced the signing of  "unprecedented" oil fields development contracts worth $13bn with domestic sub-contractor companies, the semi-official ISNA news agency reported on 17 March.
body:
The deals which consider development of six oil fields will increase Iran's oil extraction capacity by 350,000 barrels per day, the report said. However, ISNA also quoted Owji as putting numbers at $15bn and 400,000 barrels per day in his speech at a ceremony of signing the contracts.

In February, Iran announced the addition of some 150,000 barrels of oil to its daily 3.2m barrels production through seven different projects.

In his speech, Owji said that Iran was successful both in producing and exporting oil and petroleum products and despite "problems in trade" by relying on domestic development. He stressed that Tehran had not had a halt in oil exports, as it had found new markets.

Iran has been reportedly offering discounts to China and other Asian countries to sell its oil which is under the US sanctions.

The Iranian oil minister further said that some 130 semi-completed projects worth $28.5bn have been completed, and 50 new projects have been started.

Owji added that the country had increased the daily petrol production capacity to 115m litres from 97m litres since the beginning of President Ebrahim Raisi's administration in August 2021.

Earlier in March, the Oil Ministry also signed major contracts with domestic contractors to boost pressure in the South Pars gas field, which the country jointly shares with Qatar.

Source: ISNA website, Tehran, in Persian 0826 GMT 17 Mar 24

title: Chad arrests 175 after deadly clashes claim 40 lives in east
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Chad has arrested 175 suspects in connection with deadly intercommunal clashes that claimed 40 lives in the country's restive eastern region, the privately owned Alwihda Infos news website reported on 21 March.
body:
“A ministerial delegation on 21 March announced the arrest of 175 people at the scene of the clashes, as well as the seizure of 13 motorbikes and more than 30 weapons of war”, the report said.

The clashes occurred on 17 March in the village of Tileguey in Ouaddai province, according to Toumai Web Medias, adding armed men set ablaze a large part of the village.

Minister of Public Security and Immigration Gen Mahamat Charfadine Margui, who led the delegation, said that "all those involved will be prosecuted" and announced an investigation to shed light on "the unfortunate events".

Intercommunal clashes are common in eastern and southern Chad, usually involving nomadic Arab herders and sedentary indigenous farmers.

Source: Alwihda website in French 21 Mar 24

title: BBCM Iran Watchlist 4 Aug 25
snippet:
Stories being covered today by BBC Monitoring from Iranian broadcast, press and social media sources

President heralds 'new chapter' with Pakistan
body:
Iranian President Massoud Pezeshkian and his accompanying high-ranking delegation wrapped up their visit to Islamabad yesterday, returning to Tehran.

The president met Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and President Asif Ali Zardari and other top Pakistani leaders. Twelve cooperation documents were signed covering a wide range of sectors including tourism, agriculture, legal and judicial affairs, industry, science and technology, transportation, cultural heritage and trade.

While Iranian Economy Minister Mohammad Atabak had said a free trade agreement would be clinched during the visit, the parties instead signed an agreement on the "intent to finalise the free trade agreement".

Iranian Defence Minister Aziz Nasirzadeh, having met his Pakistani counterpart, expressed optimism about the future of border security and defence cooperation.

Upon departure, President Pezeshkian said in a Persian post on X the visit opened a "new chapter in diplomatic relations between Iran and Pakistan".

The visit was highly praised by Iranian papers this morning, with pro-reform Sharq daily saying it brought about "expansion of strategic ties and border security", and the conservative Khorasan newspaper speaking of "Eastern brothers". Meanwhile, moderate Setareh Sobh highlighted Pakistan's "excellent" ties with the US, suggesting it could "convey the Islamic Republic's messages and demands to the US as they are and realistically".

Iran set to sue Israel over attacks, condemns al-Aqsa Mosque 'desecration'

Iran's Deputy Foreign Minister Kazem Gharibabadi said yesterday that Tehran is preparing to pursue legal action against Israel following its attack on Iranian territory during the recent 12-day war.

He said the "documentation of the damage has been almost completed", with the report now ready, and Tehran was considering various avenues, to take a final decision on how to proceed in the coming days.

Tehran also strongly condemned what it described as "extremist Zionists' ... renewed desecration" of the al-Aqsa Mosque, Islam's third holiest located in Jerusalem, after a Jewish prayer was held in the compound. Foreign Ministry Spokesman Esmail Baqai accused the "Zionist sect ruling occupied Palestine" of seeking to erase the Islamic and historical identity of the site and provoke Muslim sentiments worldwide.

Meanwhile, Iranian newspapers widely covered anti-Israeli protests across the globe, with the state broadcaster's Jaam-e Jam newspaper terming them as a "tsunami of hate against genocide".

Press hails cleric's 'belated' resignation under public pressure

Yesterday, hardline Iranian cleric Kazem Seddiqi resigned from his post of interim Friday prayer leader of the capital Tehran, following a public backlash over corruption cases involving his family. Seddiqi had long resisted the calls for resignation.

The move appeared to have been widely welcomed across the political spectrum, as well as Iranian papers of all leanings this morning.

Conservative Agah daily called it an "ethical action", with another conservative newspaper, Quds, also praising the "good tradition of resignation". Meanwhile, conservative Siyasat-e Ruz said it was "proper, but belated", with pro-reform Hamdeli also calling the step "belated".

Another pro-reform daily, Sazandegi, saw the move as a manifestation of the "power of public opinion".

Defence Council formation seen as 'strategic response to modern threats'

Following days of media speculation on the matter, Iran's Supreme National Security Council (SNSC) approved the formation of a National Defence Council yesterday.

According to a statement from the SNSC secretariat, the new body will "centrally review defence strategies and plans aimed at strengthening the capabilities of the Armed Forces". The council will be chaired by the president and will include the heads of the judiciary and parliament, senior military commanders, as well as several key ministries.

The restructuring in the security system has been largely welcomed by the Iranian press. Conservative Jaam-e Jam hailed it as a "strategic response to modern threats".

Meanwhile, ultraconservative Keyhan daily, slammed the mood in media of welcoming the expected appointment of the leader's adviser Ali Larijani as the new secretary of the SNSC, as many had maintained he would bring about "rationality, wise behaviour and moderation" to political and security decisions.

Online users frustrated at water supply exposure

Iranian social media users took to X to express their anger over a state TV report on Tehran's water supply, that exposed details of the water distribution routes in the city.

One user was outraged that there was no "censorship or consideration" over any of the water pipes of the city.

A few users said that the map could easily be used by enemies of the country in future attacks, with a user stating that regardless of whether the move was "deliberate or unintentional", it will have "consequences".

One user said if something were to happen in the future, spies should not be blamed as the "IRIB have revealed all the details" of the water network, while another said infiltration sometimes "comes via live TV antenna".

Another user pointed out that the "the super-crisis of water is the primary challenge for governance", highlighting the sensitivity of exposing these routes.

title: Iran says foiled entry of 'terrorists' on north-eastern border
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Iran's Border Guard Force says it has prevented a "terrorist group", planning sabotage attacks, from entry into the country through the north-eastern South Khorasan Province on the border with Afghanistan, the conservative Mehr News Agency reported on 9 March.
body:
Border Guard Commander Brig Gen Ahmadali Goudarzi said the guards had received intelligence information before engaging in an armed clash with the group in the Nahbandan area of the province. Goudarzi said they inflicted a "fatal blow" to the group and some of the wounded members of the group fled to the other side of the border. The commander did not mention any arrests or deaths.

South Khorasan Province shares a 331 km border with Afghanistan, which is a frequent conduit for narcotics entering Iran.

A significant amount of equipment, including war mines, TM metal-cased mines, various remote control transmitters and receivers, war ammunition, night-vision cameras and other equipment were seized from the group, the report quoted the commander as saying.

Source: Mehr news agency, Tehran, in Persian 0912 GMT 9 Mar 24

title: South Korea mobilises 40 aircraft for live-fire drills against North
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

South Korea's Air Force said it had mobilised 40 aircraft, including F-35A, F-15K and F-4E jets, in combined live-fire drills with US forces against North Korea's missile and artillery threats, Yonhap news agency reported.
body:
"Pilots trained on staging precision strikes against simulated enemy cruise missiles flying at low altitudes with air-to-air missiles and against long-range artillery, using air-to-surface missiles and guided bombs," the Yonhap report cited the Air Force as saying.

North Korea has unveiled a new battle tank during a training exercise overseen by leader Kim Jong-un, the state-run Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) reported on 14 March. 

Earlier this year, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un had guided artillery firing drills involving front-line units capable of striking the "enemy's capital", believed to refer to Seoul.

Source: Yonhap news agency, Seoul, in English 0618 GMT 15 Mar 24

title: Fifteen deaths reported in weeks leading to bonfire celebrations in Iran
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The spokesperson for Iran's emergency medical services has said that 15 people died and 4,735 were injured in incidents related to Charshanbeh Souri celebrations in three weeks leading to 12 March, the state broadcaster-run IRIB News Agency reported on 13 March.
body:
Charshanbeh Souri (Red Wednesday) is an ancient fire festival held on the eve of the last Wednesday of the Iranian calendar year, falling on 13 March this year. Iranians across the country celebrate the occasion with a bonfire night as well as using firecrackers and other explosive material.

Babak Yektaparast told the state broadcaster's IRINN channel in a morning programme on 13 March that four out of these 15 people were killed in the previous evening during the actual celebrations.

The rest of the deaths were related to mishandling explosive material ahead of Charshanbeh Souri in a three-week period starting on 20 February. Yektaparast said that the total number was down from 19 in the same period of the previous year.

He added that from those injured, four remained in critical condition, while 257 underwent amputation surgery.

Source: IRIB News Agency, Tehran, in Persian 0522 GMT 13 Mar 24

title: Senior N Korean, Vietnamese officials hold talks in Hanoi
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

A North Korean ruling party delegation has met a senior Vietnamese official during their visit to the country, the Vietnamese news agency (VNA) website has reported.
body:
The delegation, led by Kim Song-nam, the director of the international department of North Korea's ruling Workers' Party, arrived in Vietnam on 25 March after concluding a visit to China.

Kim Song-nam met Le Hoai Trung, who chairs the Vietnamese Communist Party's Commission for External Relations, in Hanoi on 25 March. 

Trung said that the two sides should enhance exchanges and contacts at all levels to strengthen mutual understanding and develop the ties between their parties and countries across various fields, according to the VNA report.

Kim said his trip is aimed at boosting North Korea-Vietnam friendship and to discuss measures to strengthen "party building work".

Source: VNA news agency website, Hanoi, in English 0400 GMT 26 Mar 24

title: Nepal seeks return of nationals died fighting with Russian troops
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Nepal has requested Moscow to expedite the repatriation of Nepalese died while fighting with Russian troops in Ukraine, The Kathmandu Post reported on its website on 8 March.
body:
The issue was discussed during a phone call between Foreign Minister Narayan Kaji Shrestha and his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov.

The call comes weeks after the deaths of over a dozen Nepalese serving in the Russian Army, the report noted.

The Nepali side also sought compensation to the families of the deceased and facilitate the return of nationals working with the Russian Army.

An activist has said at least 20 Nepalese nationals have died while fighting alongside the Russian troops in Ukraine, the report said.

The report, citing Foreign Ministry officials, said Russian authorities have not addressed the issue of recruiting Nepalese nationals to Russia as well as the repatriation of the dead.

The Nepal government has advised its nationals against joining the Russian Army, according to the report.

See also: Briefing: India reacts to nationals reportedly seeking release from Russian army

Source: The Kathmandu Post website, Kathmandu, in English 0701 GMT 8 Mar 24

title: Highlights from press, websites in Indian-administered Kashmir 27 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a selection of major news items from select Urdu, English and Kashmiri-language press and online media sources in Indian-administered Kashmir on 27 March 2024.

Tameel-I-Irshad
body:
Climate activist ends 21-day protest fast in Leh

Noted climate activist Sonam Wangchuk on 26 March ended his 21-day-long hunger strike in support of the demand for statehood for the Ladakh region and its inclusion in the Sixth Schedule of the constitution. The Sixth Schedule contains provisions related to the administration through autonomous district councils. At the end of his fast, Wangchuk made a fresh appeal to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah to safeguard the fragile ecosystem of Himalayan mountains in Ladakh and the unique indigenous tribal cultures of the region. The climate activist said, "We do not think of Modi and Shah as just politicians, we would rather like to think of them as statesmen and for that they will have to show some character and some farsightedness." [Online, Approximate Words: 200]

[Urdu-language Tameel-I-Irshad is a pro-Kashmir separatist daily that focuses on local issues in Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours India-Pakistan talks for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Kashmir Uzma

BSF says more troops being deployed in Kashmir for elections

The Border Security Force (BSF) on 26 March said it has around 65 companies [around 6,500 men] currently deployed in Kashmir and more troops are being sent for parliamentary elections in the region. Ashok Yadav, Inspector General (IG) of BSF Kashmir Frontier, said these 65 companies and additional troops will work with the Jammu and Kashmir Police and Indian Army to enhance the security grid across all the districts. The IG BSF said with the snow melting at high mountain passes, the chances of militant infiltration from Pakistan increase. He said the melting snow also opens up rivers further increasing infiltration attempts from across the border. The IG BSF said, "We are taking this into account and are adjusting our security deployment accordingly." Yadav said the BSF has its predominant role at Line of Control (LoC) along with army to make the LoC grid strong and foil any possible infiltration. [Words: 150]

[Urdu-language Kashmir Uzma is a pro-Kashmiri separatist newspaper that is strongly critical of the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Indian armed forces. The daily prominently publishes statements by militant leaders and favours talks with separatist leaders and Pakistan for the resolution of India-Pakistan dispute on Kashmir.]

Daily Chattan

Police book two persons under PSA for 'anti-India' activities

The Jammu and Kashmir Police on 26 March claimed to have arrested two persons under the Public Safety Act (PSA) over their alleged anti-India activities in north Kashmir's Bandipora district. A person can be held for up to two years without trial under the PSA. Police identified the arrested as Danish Parvez and Abrar Ahmad Wani, both residents of Sumlar Bandipora and said the duo has been transferred to Kot Bhalwal Jail in Jammu. [Online, Approximate Words: 150]

[Urdu-language Daily Chattan is a pro-Kashmir separatist, pro-militant daily that is popular in the northern part of Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours talks with Pakistan for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Nida-I-Mashriq

Editorial says Kashmiri politicians only 'lust for power'

A 27 March editorial said the three Members of Parliament (MPs) that Kashmir elected in last parliamentary elections have done nothing for the people and most of the politicians in the region have only lust for power. The editorial said: "In the last parliamentary elections, the National Conference won in Kashmir and the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) in Jammu. The elected representatives of Jammu have done a lot for the people of the region and given a new dimension to the process of development. They played an important role in minimizing the severity of the power crisis, improved road connectivity, gave new flyovers to the region, new institutions and hospitals... etc to Jammu. However, nothing is known about the performance of three MPs from Kashmir, except one of them was constantly absent from parliament. They did nothing to resolve the political, social, economic and administrative problems of the people. The contenders for political leadership from the region are a blot on the name of Kashmir. The politicians from Kashmir are an embodiment of dishonour and their lust for power is visible from a distance." [Online, Approximate Words: 700]

[Urdu-language daily Nida-I-Mashriq is a pro-separatist daily that focuses on local issues of Kashmir. The daily is critical of the state and the federal government, and favours talks with separatists and Pakistan for the resolution of Kashmir.]

Srinagar Times

Editorial discusses future of possible 'third front' in Kashmir

A 27 March editorial discussed the possibility of the formation of a third front in Kashmir during the forthcoming parliamentary elections and its future. The editorial said: "There are talks in Kashmir about the emergence of a third front in Jammu and Kashmir. Syed Altaf Bukhari, a former minister and president of the Jammu and Kashmir Apni party (JKAP), and Ghulam Nabi Azad, the former chief minister of Jammu and Kashmir and president of Democratic Progressive Azad Party (DPAP), who had been far away from each other, are coming closer today. It is being said the friendship between the two politicians is going to turn into a partnership, and this partnership will also include Sajjad Ghani Lone, the leader of the People's Conference. At this time, the negotiations are going on among the three parties on which candidate will be fielded in the electoral fray, and who will leave the field in favour of which candidate. There will be a lot of thinking going on about these issues. These three parties will take any decision while maintaining their honour and dignity, in absence of which, one or two of these political parties may lose their position and may even 'disappear' from the political scene of Jammu and Kashmir. The 'silence' of Muzaffar Hussain Baig, former deputy chief minister has also become a mystery. However, due to his recent political activities, it seems that he too is waiting for an appropriate moment and may turn to one side or another at the opportune moment." [Online, Approximate Words: 700]

[Urdu-language Srinagar Times is a pro-Kashmir separatist, pro-militant daily that focuses on local issues in Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours talks with Pakistan for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Urdu and Kashmiri 27 Mar 24

title: Highlights from press, websites in Indian-administered Kashmir 29 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a selection of major news items from select Urdu, English and Kashmiri-language press and online media sources in Indian-administered Kashmir on 29 March 2024.

Daily Aftab
body:
40 BJP leaders, including PM Modi, to campaign in Kashmir

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has unveiled an extensive parliamentary election campaign strategy in Jammu and Kashmir, with 40 party leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi, home minister Amit Shah, and other prominent national figures set to campaign in the region. According to unidentified sources, PM Modi will likely address an election rally in south Kashmir's Anantnag, while Amit Shah will address separate rallies in Srinagar. Defence minister Rajnath Singh will address public rallies in north Kashmir's Kupwara and Baramulla. Among other high-profile leaders slated to participate in the campaign are BJP national president Jagat Prakash Nadda, transport and highways minister Nitin Gadkari, and Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, among others. However, the dates for the campaigning events have not been announced yet. [Online, Approximate Words: 250]

[Urdu-language Daily Aftab is a pro-separatist daily that focuses on local issues of Kashmir valley. The daily is critical of the state and the federal government, and favours talks with separatists and Pakistan for the resolution of India-Pakistan dispute over Kashmir.]

Tameel-I-Irshad

Top army commander reviews security in north Kashmir

Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai, General Officer Commanding (GOC) of the Indian Army's 15 Corps or Chinar Corps, on 28 March visited the Rashtriya Rifles formations deployed in the counter-terrorism grid in north Kashmir and reviewed the security situation and operational preparedness there. During his visit, Lieutenant General Ghai encouraged the soldiers to be in a state of high operational readiness in the face of challenges ahead. The commander appreciated the soldiers for performing their services with dignity despite the extreme weather conditions and other operational challenges. He told the soldiers at the Line of Control (LoC) that more vigilance is needed to "thwart the plans of anti-peace elements". [Online, Approximate Words: 150]

[Urdu-language Tameel-I-Irshad is a pro-Kashmir separatist daily that focuses on local issues in Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours India-Pakistan talks for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Daily Chattan

PDP urges government to fulfil commitment on AFSPA

Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti termed home minister Amit Shah's statement on possible revocation of Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) and withdrawal of troops from Jammu and Kashmir, as part of the party's Agenda of Alliance (AOA) with BJP in 2014. Mufti said one can only hope that the government will at least fulfil its promise on this matter because it will be a huge relief to the people here. Taking to a US-based micro-blogging website, Mufti said, "PDP has consistently called for the repeal of the stringent AFSPA with gradual withdrawal of troops. It also formed an important part of our agenda of alliance to which the BJP wholeheartedly agreed." She said, "Better late than never, but only if it's not gibberish like creating two crore [20 million] jobs every year or empty promises of depositing 15 lakhs [$18,000] in bank accounts." She added, "One can only hope that they fulfil their commitment at least in this case since it would bring a huge relief to the people of Jammu and Kashmir. To walk the talk perhaps MHA [Ministry of Home Affairs] can start by releasing journalists and thousands of young Kashmiri boys currently languishing in jails without any charges or prosecution." [Online, Approximate Words: 175]

[Urdu-language Daily Chattan is a pro-Kashmir separatist, pro-militant daily that is popular in the northern part of Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours talks with Pakistan for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Nida-I-Mashriq

Administration uses pigeons to attract people for voting

The regional administration on 28 March used a unique way to attract and inform people in north Kashmir's Bandipora district about voting in the forthcoming parliamentary elections by using pigeons. The pigeons were released with a slip of paper attached to them to attract people and increase their interest in elections. Unidentified officials said this has been an ancient tradition in Kashmir, which has been put into use in Bandipora. They said such an initiative has been taken to inform the voters about the importance of casting their ballot. [Online, Approximate Words: 100]

[Urdu-language daily Nida-I-Mashriq is a pro-separatist daily that focuses on local issues of Kashmir. The daily is critical of the state and the federal government, and favours talks with separatists and Pakistan for the resolution of Kashmir.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Urdu and Kashmiri 29 Mar 24

title: India, US conclude joint maritime drills for enhanced cooperation
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

India and the US have completed their "Sea Defenders-2024" security exercise, India's Press Information Bureau quoted the defence ministry as saying in a statement.
body:
The drills between the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) and the US Coast Guard (USCG) ended at India's Port Blair city, the capital of the federally-ruled Andaman and Nicobar Islands, on 9 March.

According to an official statement from India's Ministry of Defence, the exercise was aimed at increasing maritime cooperation and inter-operability between the two sides.

The drills focused on several scenarios, such as responses to oil spills and other environmental hazards, aerial surveillance and rescue missions, and combating threats similar to drone attacks on commercial merchant vessels, the statement noted. 

The statement added that the joint exercises give "valuable training opportunities for both Coast Guards, allowing them to refine their skills and improve their ability to work together in a coordinated manner."

USCG Cutter Bertholf, the coast guard's first national security cutter, took part in the drills following which it left Port Blair, the statement further said.

USCGC Bertholf's visit to Port Blair "serves as a powerful symbol of the growing partnership between the US and Indian Coast Guard", the statement added.

It noted: "Through collaborative efforts, both nations are working toward a safer and more secure maritime environment."

See also: Briefing: India commissions second naval base close to Maldives amid tensions

Source: Government of Indian Press Information Bureau website, New Delhi, in English 1550 GMT 9 Mar 24

title: Man charged with 'justification of terrorism' online over Moscow attack
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Russia has charged a resident of St Petersburg with "justification of terrorism" over his social media comments about the 22 March deadly attack on the Crocus City Hall outside Moscow, TASS news agency reported on 27 March.
body:
The St Petersburg branch of Investigations Committee said that Nikolai Konashenok, 41, made some comments about the attack between 22 and 25 March, TASS news agency reported, but did not provide the actual social media posts.

Two days before the prosecutors put forward charges, Konashenok's wife Roxana Shatunovskaya said she would step down as the director-general of New Holland, where she has worked for more than 12 years, because of her husband's comments, Fontanka news website reported on 25 March. New Holland is an organisation specialising in cultural urbanisation, co-founded by billionaire Roman Abramovich.

The 22 March terrorist attack on the Crocus City Hall outside Moscow left at least 139 dead according to the latest estimates. A total of eight suspects linked to the attack have been remanded by a Moscow court so far.

Source: TASS news agency, Moscow, in Russian 0801 gmt 27 Mar 24

title: Highlights from Maldives' Dhivehi-language press, websites 15 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a BBCM selection of major news items published in Maldives' Dhivehi-language press and online media outlets on 15 March 2024.

Sun.mv
body:
Government prepones exams due to elections

The Ministry of Education announced on 14 March that examinations for classes seven, eight, and nine will be preponed since the current dates clash with the forthcoming parliament election. According to the 2024 academic calendar, the final examinations for these grades were scheduled to begin on 16 April. However, the ministry, in a circular it issued, said examinations will now be held from 27 March until 25 April. The ministry also said if schools are to hold examinations on 20 April, they should discuss the issue first with the election focal point designated for the school. According to the earlier academic calendar published by the ministry, the second term for the 2023/2024 academic year was scheduled to end on 13 June, and the new academic year to start on 31 July. However, with the government decision to again change the academic year for the country to start in January, the new academic year is now scheduled to start on 26 May (compressed year for 2024, with the next academic year to start in January 2024). [Online, Approximate Words: 150]

[This is a prominent Dhivehi-language news website that generally carries objective reporting. It is owned by the Sun Media Group, the largest private media house in the Maldives.]

Avas

Defence chief to retire in Apr

Chief of Defence Force, Lieutenant General Abdul Raheem Abdul Latheef, on 14 March announced his decision to retire from military service in April. According to the Military Service Act, a soldier can remain in service until 60 years, which Latheef will be in April. Latheef was appointed defence chief on 17 November 2023 after President Dr Mohamed Muizzu's inauguration on the same day. [Online, Approximate Words: 100]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website run by "Mundoo" Adam Haleem and owned by former lawmaker Abdullah Sinan. The website is generally critical of the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party and Jumhooree Party.]

Mihaaru

Government to launch drone monitoring on 15 Mar

The Maldivian government has decided to commence on 15 March efforts to monitor its Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) using the two drones it purchased from Turkey. The Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF) will be holding the ceremony to launch the effort at Maafaru in Noonu Atoll, where it has decided to establish a drone base at the international airport at the island. Although the government has not yet made an official announcement on the drones, pictures and videos show that the two drones purchased from Turkey are "Bayraktar TB2" drones, capable of being operated above 25,000 feet for a continuous 27 hours. Reports indicate that a team from MNDF has undergone training in Turkey on operating the drones. President Muizzu had earlier announced that his administration will establish the capability to monitor its maritime territory on its own. The Maldives has to date monitored its territory with assistance from India, which also has control over the radar system established in the north. [Online, Approximate Words: 400]

[Mihaaru is a Dhivehi-language daily that generally carries objective reporting and does not appear to favour any political party. The newspaper widely covers political developments, radicalisation, and counter-terrorism-related developments in the Maldives.]

Raajje.mv

Immigration apprehends seven foreign workers

Maldives Immigration on 14 March reported that it has apprehended seven foreigners on suspicion of selling foreign currency on the black market. It said in accordance with the policies of the Ministry of Homeland Security and Technology, it had conducted an operation on 9 March targeting undocumented foreign labourers active in the dollar black market near the Bank of Maldives USD ATM at Maafannu Starclouds building. The operation was conducted by Immigration's Risk Intelligence and Legal Affairs, and Enforcement and Compliance Division. Immigration also said the seven apprehended included undocumented foreign workers as well as workers working outside the scope of their work permits. [Online, Approximate Words: 180]

[This is the Dhivehi-language website of widely watched, privately-run television news channel Raajje TV that supports the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website provides detailed coverage of government actions and statements and sometimes criticises Chinese involvement in the Maldives.]

Vaguthu

Corrections reviewing concessions given to ex-president

The Maldives Correctional Service (MCS) on 14 March said it is reviewing the concessions provided to former president Abdulla Yameen on his prison sentence. Yameen, who is serving his prison sentence under house arrest, had participated in a political campaign activity held in Hulhumale (reclaimed suburb of capital Male), contravening the terms of the concession agreement. The MCS had provided concessions for Yameen to travel within Male, Villimale and Hulhumale, meet with members of the public and participate in meetings held in the region. However, he is not allowed to participate in any political activities. [Online, Approximate Words: 120]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website that was founded by a youth group that favours the ruling Progressive Party of Maldives and People's National Congress and criticises politicians from the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website generally backs China and strongly criticises India.]

Channel News Maldives

Government establishes independent panel on housing

The Ministry of Housing, Land and Urban Development on 14 March announced that it has constituted an independent committee to advice the ministry on complains related to the allocation of housing and land by the previous government. The ministry said the committee has been established on the advice of President Muizzu. Former gender minister Aneesa Ahmed was appointed the chair of the committee and former ambassador to Sri Lanka, Abdul Azeez Yusuf, appointed the vice-chair. [Online, Approximate Words: 150]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website formerly known as Voice of Free Press run by prominent journalist Ismail Rasheed. It carried original reporting, editorial and commentaries primarily on domestic political and socio-economic issues and does not favour Indian or Chinese involvement in the country.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Dhivehi 15 Mar 24

title: Highlights from Maldives' Dhivehi-language press, websites 14 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a BBCM selection of major news items published in Maldives' Dhivehi-language press and online media outlets on 14 March 2024.

Sun.mv
body:
Italian company to establish bunkering facility in north

The State Trading Organisation [STO, a majority government-owned trading company] on 13 March signed an agreement with Vitol, an Italian company, to establish an international bunkering facility in Ihavandhippolhu, the Maldives Economic Gateway. Minister of Economic Development Mohamed Saeed and Minister of State for Finance Ahmed Mazin participated in a ceremony held to sign the agreement. STO's Chief Executive Officer Shimad Ibrahim and Vitol's Director Jay Ang signed the agreement on behalf of their respective companies. At the ceremony, Ibrahim highlighted that Vitol is the largest company in the energy sector in the world and that the project will deliver various economic benefits to both the company, its shareholders and for the government's tax revenue receipts. [Online, Approximate Words: 270]

[This is a prominent Dhivehi-language news website that generally carries objective reporting. It is owned by the Sun Media Group, the largest private media house in the Maldives.]

Avas

President nominates candidate for tax commissioner

President Dr Mohamed Muizzu proposed to parliament the appointment of the former heads of the Maldives Inland Revenue Authority (MIRA), Yazeed Mohamed and Hassan Zareer, for the position of Commissioner General of Taxation. Mohamed had been the commissioner general during former president Abdulla Yameen's administration, while Zareer had been the deputy commissioner general. The commissioner general position was made vacant after Fathuhulla Jameel, who had been appointed to the position on 31 October 2019, resigned to contest in the forthcoming parliament election on a ticket from opposition Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP). [Online, Approximate Words: 170]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website run by "Mundoo" Adam Haleem and owned by former lawmaker Abdullah Sinan. The website is generally critical of the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party and Jumhooree Party.]

Mihaaru

President nominates envoys for Singapore, Geneva

President Muizzu has proposed to parliament the appointment of Mohamed Luveiz as the Maldives' ambassador to Singapore and Dr Salma Rasheed as the Maldives' permanent representative to the UN Mission in Geneva. Rasheed is the sister of former member of parliament for Maafannu Medhu constituency, Asma Rasheed, who is contesting for the same seat in the forthcoming election, and also the aunt of Mohamed Hussain Shareef, who Muizzu has proposed as the Maldives envoy to the United Arab Emirates (UAE). Luveiz was the former minister of state for economic relations at the President's Office during former president Yameen's administration and had spearheaded much of that government's economic development agenda. Speaker Mohamed Aslam on 13 March announced that the nominations have been sent to the parliament committee on foreign relations for review. [Online, Approximate Words: 200]

[Mihaaru is a Dhivehi-language daily that generally carries objective reporting and does not appear to favour any political party. The newspaper widely covers political developments, radicalisation, and counter-terrorism-related developments in the Maldives.]

Raajje.mv

MDP president denies links to local news website

President of the Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP), Abdulla Shahid, on 13 March denied claims of having links to local online news website Dhiyavaru. Shahid said this while responding to allegations made by Member of Parliament for Thinadhoo Dhekunu constituency, Abdulla Saneef, in parliament. Shahid also said "lying and defaming people by hiding behind parliamentary privileges is alien to the principles of democracy". [Online, Approximate Words: 200]

[This is the Dhivehi-language website of widely watched, privately-run television news channel Raajje TV that supports the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website provides detailed coverage of government actions and statements and sometimes criticises Chinese involvement in the Maldives.]

Vaguthu

Election body appoints new vice-president

The Elections Commission on 13 March appointed its member Ali Nashath as its vice-president. The commission said Ismail Habeeb's term had expired on 12 March after serving two terms, and as such, in accordance with the law, the commission had elected its new vice-president at a meeting held on 13 March. Nashath was first appointed to the commission on 25 July 2018, during former president Yameen's administration, and was re-appointed on 16 November 2023. [Online, Approximate Words: 180]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website that was founded by a youth group that favours the ruling Progressive Party of Maldives and People's National Congress and criticises politicians from the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website generally backs China and strongly criticises India.]

Channel News Maldives

Democrats express support for anti-defection bill

The Democrats on 13 March said it supports approving the anti-defection bill with certain amendments. Party president and Member of Parliament for Henveiru Hulhangu constituency, Hassan Latheef, while debating the bill in parliament, highlighted its importance but said that articles in the bill on recall votes at the parliament committee stage must be revisited. He proposed amending the bill to include provisions to allow constituencies to decide on removing their representative. [Online, Approximate Words: 230]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website formerly known as Voice of Free Press run by prominent journalist Ismail Rasheed. It carried original reporting, editorial and commentaries primarily on domestic political and socio-economic issues and does not favour Indian or Chinese involvement in the country.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Dhivehi 14 Mar 24

title: Pakistan's Samaa News TV show on controversies surrounding top court
snippet:
The following is a summary of the talk show "Nadeem Malik Live" hosted by anchor Nadeem Malik, a senior journalist and analyst, on moderate Samaa News TV in Urdu at 15:00 GMT on 7 March 2024. The programme invites politicians and analysts to express their opinions on important issues.

Anchor Nadeem Malik said the Supreme Judicial Council (SJC) found former Supreme Court judge Mazahar Ali Akbar Naqvi "guilty of misconduct". He termed it a "very important decision" because usually when a Supreme Court judge, against whom a complaint has been filed, resigns and goes home, the case against them is closed. He noted this is the first time that the SJC has drawn a line that the case would not be closed and would be taken to its "logical conclusion" even if the judge quits the office. He mentioned Naqvi had given a "very controversial judgement" about the court which gave a verdict in a high treason case. He cited several other cases which need to be reviewed by the SJC.
body:
Malik said the Peshawar High Court has stopped the members nominated for reserved seats from taking oath till 13 March and noted the issue might end up going to the Supreme Court.

Malik asked Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) member Sardar Latif Khosa to comment on the SJC's verdict. Khosa said the verdict against Naqvi is "unprecedented" and an "action in revenge". He noted references against judges were never maintained after they resigned from the office. He alleged Chief Justice Qazi Faez Isa had also committed "misconduct" when he refused to sit in the benches constituted by former chief justice Umar Ata Bandial on several cases. He added former judge Ijazul Ahsan also resigned because he "could not get along with Chief Justice Isa".

Malik asked Khosa whether he agrees that those who had sentenced Zulfikar Ali Bhutto (former president and prime minister) to death should be posthumously sentenced after a recent verdict of the Supreme Court which stated that Bhutto was not given a fair trial. Khosa replied he "100 per cent agrees" with Malik and cited an example of a "posthumous trial" of Cromwell in Britain. He remarked Imran Khan (former PTI chairperson) is another prime minister who is a "heartthrob of the people" and is being targeted currently and demanded justice for him. He claimed people have reacted against political victimisation of the PTI by giving it a two-thirds majority.

Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) politician Palwasha Khan said other controversial cases should also be reviewed and noted many judgements of the judiciary have "thrown Pakistan into turmoil" and the nation is feeling their "aftershocks" even today. She insisted those responsible for such judgements should be held accountable.

Talking about the Bhutto case, Khan said it is not possible to say that justice has been done to Bhutto as he lost his life. She was of the view that the court should have named those who had issued that unfair judgement. She added even though those people are dead, "handcuffs could have been placed over their graves" as a symbolic punishment.

Khan said the PPP would not be affected even if the Sunni Ittehad Council (SIC) is given the reserved seats because the former has the required numbers to get Asif Ali Zardari (senior PPP politician) elected as the president on 9 March.

Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) politician Abid Sher Ali said judges should also be held accountable because their verdicts affect lives of millions of people. He remarked Naqvi was a "dishonest" person and had "strangulated justice". He argued judges like Naqvi and Ijazul Ahsan sent an elected prime minister [Nawaz Sharif] home to serve their personal interests and "violated the sanctity of the judiciary".

Responding to Malik's question on whether reserved seats should be allotted to the SIC, Ali said if the SIC has submitted a list of candidates for reserved seats, it should be given those seats at any cost. However, he added, if it did not do so, the matter would be settled in the court. He commented the Supreme Court will not give its verdict on the basis of "sympathy", but according to the law and the Constitution.

Ali was of the view that those involved in the 9 May incidents (violent protests by alleged PTI members after the arrest of Imran Khan) of attacks on military installations and monuments of martyrs should "never be spared".

Source: Samaa TV, Karachi, in Urdu 1500 GMT 7 Mar 24

title: Highlights from Pakistan's Sindhi-language TV, press 11 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a BBCM selection of major news items published in Pakistan's Sindhi-language TV and press media outlets on 11 March 2024.

Awami Awaz
body:
Two militants killed, one injured in KP blast

Two alleged "terrorists" were reported killed and one injured in an explosion at Board Bazar on the morning of 10 March in Peshawar, the capital city of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP) province. According to the police, a four-five kilogram explosive was used in this blast. The explosion occurred during the transfer of the explosive. Police said that two militants who were transferring the explosive were immediately killed in the explosion, while one was critically injured. All three have been identified as residents of Peshawar who were wanted by the Counter Terrorism Department (CTD). [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 150]

Editorial discusses politician's second tenure as president

"In a democratic system, the people are the first priority of the government and state, but we have witnessed that some undemocratic elements are also within the political parties. We have also witnessed some individuals who have presented great sacrifices for the people. In fact, in Pakistan, democracy is still weak… As a result of elections on 8 February, the politician of the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP), Asif Ali Zardari, has taken oath as the 14th president of Pakistan. He was also elected president in 2008 and had proven to be a democratic president who strengthened the parliament by giving most of his powers to the parliament. He advised the parliament to carry out the 18th amendment to the Constitution to get rid of contamination from the Constitution included during dictatorial rules in the country. Now, he has become the president once again and we welcome him from our hearts. Zardari was a joint candidate of all the parties supporting this coalition federal government. He comprehensively defeated the opposition, Sunni Ittehad Council (SIC) [elected members supported by the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party joined the SIC after being elected as independent members] supported candidate Mahmood Khan Achakzai… In our view, Asif Ali Zardari was the most apt politician for this position. He has the ability and quality to take everyone along together. He is a very shrewd politician who knows how to convince others. He believes in democratic and reconciliatory politics. We welcome Asif Ali Zardari as president for these qualities and hope that the democratic system in the country will be strengthened. We also hope that he will convince the PTI to conduct national politics in a way that does not harm the country and this is the need of the hour." [Page: 4, Approximate Words: 600]

[Daily Awami Awaz is a progressive, secular and liberal, left-leaning Sindhi-language newspaper published from Karachi, Sindh. The daily possesses a good reputation among relatively educated and aware people. It is regarded as the "Dawn" of Sindhi-language newspapers.]

Ibrat

PTI politicians arrested during protest in Lahore

The PTI had announced that it would hold protest demonstrations on 10 March across the country, against alleged rigging in the general elections held on 8 February. The only disturbance during these protests was reported from Lahore, Punjab, where police arrested several PTI politicians including Sardar Latif Khosa and Salman Akram Raja. Khosa was arrested from the cantonment area and Raja was arrested from the Ichhra area of Lahore. The PTI activists wanted to reach GPO Roundabout for the protest, but police stopped them by force, using baton charge. The PTI workers were dispersed by the police and several were arrested. In Peshawar, a sizeable crowd gathered, and was addressed by the Chief Minister of KP, Ali Amin Gandapur, who demanded a re-election in the country. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 200]

PM Sharif increases Ramadan relief package

Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has nearly doubled the (relief) amount for people during the holy month of Ramadan, from 7.5bn rupees to 12.5bn rupees ($26.8m to $44.7m). He has done this to give relief to the people who are facing extreme difficulties in the month of Ramadan because traders have nearly doubled the prices of vegetables, fruits and meat. According to the Prime Minister's Office, mobile units will also provide food at cheaper rates. Initially, 1,200 mobile units will provide this relief to people in poorer areas across the country. Approximately 40 million families will be provided relief in this manner. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 250]

[Daily Ibrat is a moderate Sindhi-language newspaper owned by the politically influential Qazi family of Sindh, traditionally affiliated with Pakistan Peoples Party. The daily is published from Hyderabad, Sindh. Readers over 40 years of age prefer reading Daily Ibrat.]

Kawish

Asif Ali Zardari sworn in as president of Pakistan

Frontline politician of the PPP, Asif Ali Zardari, was sworn in as the 14th president of the country on 10 March, at the President's House in the national capital, Islamabad. Former president Arif Alvi, Prime Minister Sharif, Army Chief General Syed Asim Munir and foreign diplomats attended the ceremony. The Chief Justice of Pakistan, Qazi Faez Isa, administered Zardari's oath. Zardari has become president of the country for a second time. He was first elected president in 2008 and remained in this post till 2013. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 200]

Balochistan chief announces clemency for militants

Chief Minister of Balochistan, Sarfraz Bugti, talking to a private television news channel, said that there will be total clemency for those militants who surrender their arms and return to the national stream. He said that the people who are in the mountains should surrender their arms and come back and reconcile with the people they have harmed, violating the tribal traditions of Balochistan. He said that the doors of the government and state are open to everyone, including Brahumdagh Bugti and Hyrbyair Marri (Blaoch nationalists). [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 120]

[Daily Kawish is the most widely read Sindhi-language newspaper published from Hyderabad, Sindh. The paper is popular among young people and has a liberal and progressive editorial policy. It is also the largest circulated daily.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Sindhi 11 Mar 24
