The district meetings were also attended by select BJP politicians. RSS and its affiliates will reportedly hold thousands of meetings in next 15-20 days across Maharashtra and make an appeal to re-elect Prime Minister Narendra Modi. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 150]

Party to announce election candidates on 26 March

Shiv Sena Member of Parliament (MP), Sanjay Mandlik, on 25 March said that seat distribution in Mahayuti is reportedly in its last stage. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde will announce Shiv Sena candidates for Lok Sabha elections on 26 March. It was reportedly said that Mandlik may not get a chance for re-election but he said that the chief minister had assured him that candidature of all of them was decided. [Page: 2, Approximate Words: 250]

[Lokmat is a popular Marathi-language daily edited by Vijay Darda, a Congress party member. The paper is mostly critical of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) government especially on its handling of Kashmir, terrorism and economic issues.]

Pudhari

Party to announce 15 election candidates

Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray party will reportedly announce 15-16 of its candidates for Lok Sabha elections on 26 March. Party spokesperson Sanjay Raut said on 25 March that there was no dispute over seat sharing in the MVA and that people were with the coalition. [Page: 1, Approximate Words: 300]

Woman held with cocaine worth $2.3m at Mumbai airport

Federal agency Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) on 24 March arrested a woman passenger at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai and recovered cocaine worth 197.9m rupees ($2.3m) from her. The accused is a citizen of Sierra Leone and arrived in Mumbai from Nairobi [capital of Kenya]. [Page: 3, Approximate Words: 120]

[Pudhari is the second-largest Marathi-language daily that is nationalist and right-of-centre. The daily backs the Indian government on issues such as national security, terrorism and Kashmir.]

Maharashtra Times

News report on party's offer to politician

Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) Chief, Raj Thackeray, recently met with BJP politician and federal minister, Amit Shah, in New Delhi (national capital). The BJP has reportedly suggested Thackeray to merge his party in Shiv Sena and takeover the party's leadership, saying that he was the real ''heir'' of Hindutva (Hindu nationalism) ideology of party founder, Balasaheb Thackeray. According to sources quoted in the news daily New Indian Express, the BJP told Thackeray that the decision will benefit him politically. Present leadership of Shiv Sena is seemingly reluctant to handover leadership to the MNS chief but the BJP is ''firm'' on its offer, assuring Eknath Shinde that Lok Sabha elections results will have no impact on his chief minister post. [Online, Approximate Words: 150]

[Maharashtra Times is a Marathi-language daily from the influential Times of India media group. The daily is observed to be critical of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government on its handling of the economic issues and alleged suppression of dissent. However, it backs the government on national security issues.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Marathi 0000 GMT 26 Mar 24

title: Afghan-based IS militants behind Moscow attack - Pakistan official
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

A senior Pakistani official has alleged that the 22 March attack on concert-goers in Moscow was organized by terrorists from Central Asia who have hideouts in Afghanistan, private Channel One (1TV) reported on 25 March.
body:
The Islamic State group claimed responsibility for the attack but did not clarify which of its global branches was responsible for the attack.

The information minister of Pakistan's Baluchistan Province, Jan Achakzai, has said that the expansion of terrorist activities is not just a threat to Central Asia and Russia but to the very fabric of global security, the report said, quoting an article carried by the News International.

A political commentator interviewed in the report accused the West of seeking to undermine its adversaries by supporting terrorist groups.

Speaking to the channel via video call, Kabul-based political commentator Salim Paigir said: "There is no doubt that [terrorist] groups have been emboldened, but such extent is unbelievable. The groups that carry out explosions and suicide attacks in Tehran and Moscow have been established major countries, and they use them for their interests."

"Hence, neither the people of Afghanistan nor any other group here can be blamed, other than the major countries that use the name of Islam and Islamic groups for their interests," he added.

Earlier, senior US Congressmen had said that the Islamic State (IS) posed a threat to the United States and Europe, the report added.

Source: Afghanistan Channel One (1TV), Kabul, in Dari 1300 GMT 25 Mar 24

title: Highlights from Maldives' Dhivehi-language press, websites 26 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a BBCM selection of major news items published in Maldives' Dhivehi-language press and online media outlets on 26 March 2024.

Sun.mv
body:
Japan to provide $6m in grant aid to Maldives

The Maldives and Japan on 25 March signed four agreements, under which Japan will provide $6m in grant aid to the Maldives. The agreements were signed by Minister of Foreign Affairs Moosa Zameer and ambassador of Japan to Maldives, Takeuchi Midori. The four agreements were on the provision of a patrol vessel to the Maldives Customs Service (MCS), a grant of 260m Japanese Yen for the implementation of the project for the enhancement of ability in maritime safety and security, a grant of 600m Japanese Yen for the provision of equipment toward strengthening Maldives' national response capacity to high frequent natural hazards through community empowerment, and a grant of 56m Japanese Yen for the provision of equipment to support operations of patrol vessels to the MCS. [Online, Approximate Words: 120]

[This is a prominent Dhivehi-language news website that generally carries objective reporting. It is owned by the Sun Media Group, the largest private media house in the Maldives.]

Mihaaru

'Miscommunication' behind India boarding Maldivian vessels

Minister of Defence Mohamed Ghassan Maumoon on 25 March said India has officially informed the Maldives that its navy officers had boarded three Maldivian fishing vessels in Maldivian waters due to a "miscommunication". Responding to questions from lawmakers in parliament, the minister said India has also informed the Maldives that its navy had boarded the vessels because they had had satellite phones and that they had believed it was illegal. The minister said while the use of satellite phones in Indian waters was banned after an amendment to certain Indian regulations, it was mandatory under Maldivian regulations to have one, especially if the vessels venture outside a certain distance. Responding to a question by Member of Parliament for Hulhumale, Ali Niyaz, on whether the minister believed in the response, the minister said he believed it had been a miscommunication, and that the Maldivian Chief of Defence Force, who had been in India on an official visit at the time, had also been informed by senior policy-level Indian officials of the same. The minister, however, said there are various established channels between neighbouring countries to provide information to each other when such operations are undertaken on the seas, but that it was surprising that no information had been shared on the operation undertaken where the Indian Navy had boarded the Maldivian vessels. The minister also confirmed that the Maldivian vessels had been inside Maldivian waters prior to and when the operation was conducted and had not ventured into Indian waters. He added that future measures will include increased coordination between all countries and establish a mechanism to work together, as well as increase the capability within the Maldives to monitor its own borders, which the government has already started. [Online, Approximate Words: 560]

President says drones to be operated by Maldivians

President Dr Mohamed Muizzu on 25 March said the military drones being utilised to monitor the Maldives' Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) will be operated exclusively by Maldivian military personnel and that no foreign soldiers will be based in the Maldives to do so. Responding to a question from a member of the public on the daily "President's Answer" series, the president said he does not support any foreign military presence being established in the Maldives, and noted that a team from the Maldives National Defence Force (MNDF) has undergone training in Turkey on operating the drones, and that further teams will be trained in the coming days. [Online, Approximate Words: 330]

[Mihaaru is a Dhivehi-language daily that generally carries objective reporting and does not appear to favour any political party. The newspaper widely covers political developments, radicalisation, and counter-terrorism-related developments in the Maldives.]

Raajje.mv

Minister clarifies approval given to Chinese vessel

Minister of Defence Ghassan Maumoon on 25 March said in parliament that approval for Chinese research vessel Xian Yang Hong 3 to enter the Maldives Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) had been provided after considering established procedures and that no approval had been given for the vessel to conduct any kind of research in the Maldives. Responding to questions from lawmakers in parliament, the minister added that the vessel had been active in the Maldives region in 2022 as well, similar to its recent visit to the region. The minister said that approval had been given only to dock to change crew and take on supplies. [Online, Approximate Words: 360]

[This is the Dhivehi-language website of widely watched, privately-run television news channel Raajje TV that supports the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website provides detailed coverage of government actions and statements and sometimes criticises Chinese involvement in the Maldives.]

Vaguthu

Minister to share drone purchase details at closed session

Minister of Defence Ghassan Maumoon on 25 March said in parliament that he will provide information on the drones purchased by the government for the monitoring of the Maldives' EEZ at the parliament committee on security services. Responding to questions by lawmakers on the cost of the purchase, the minister said given that it is information related to the military and national security, he cannot disclose such details at a general session of parliament but will share it at a close session of the committee. He assured the parliament that the drones had been purchased in accordance to the Maldivian constitution and laws, and that the government will share all documentation related to the purchase at the closed committee meeting, if required. Opposition Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP) has alleged corruption in the purchase of the drones. [Online, Approximate Words: 260]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website that was founded by a youth group that favours the ruling Progressive Party of Maldives and People's National Congress and criticises politicians from the opposition Maldivian Democratic Party. The website generally backs China and strongly criticises India.]

Channel News Maldives

President says China to develop all roads in capital

President Dr Mohamed Muizzu on 25 March said all roads in capital Male will be developed by China under grant assistance. At an event to inaugurate the campaign hall for a candidate contesting in the forthcoming parliament election, the president highlighted that the government's top priorities for the Male region are housing and road development. He announced that China has agreed to develop all the roads in Male under a grant. [Online, Approximate Words: 100]

[This is a Dhivehi-language news website formerly known as Voice of Free Press run by prominent journalist Ismail Rasheed. It carried original reporting, editorial and commentaries primarily on domestic political and socio-economic issues and does not favour Indian or Chinese involvement in the country.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Dhivehi 26 Mar 24

title: Paper urges Pakistan to seek China's help over renewable energy
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

An article in The Express Tribune paper has urged authorities to seek China’s help to develop the renewable energy sector.
body:
"Given Pakistan’s close economic relations with China and given the attention that Beijing has begun to give to developing new sources of energy, Pakistan could turn to Beijing for help for developing some of these resources," the article said on 18 March.

It added Pakistan could make the renewable sources of energy an "important component" of the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) programme.

It urged authorities to focus on renewable energy and reduce dependence on fossil fuels, adding different governments had "paid little attention" to the sector.

It noted most of Pakistan’s investments in energy were used to build coal-fired plants, including those brought to Pakistan from China.

The article highlighted a Chinese government pledge to accelerate the construction of solar panel farms as well as wind and hydroelectric projects. 

"This emphasis on renewables is part of Beijing’s effort to reignite its faltering economy. China’s leadership says that it has decided to focus on a 'new trio' of industries - solar panels, electric cars and lithium batteries - replacing the old trio of clothing, furniture and electric appliances," it added.

Such efforts have made Beijing a major supplier to the world of electric cars and solar panels, it said.

Pakistan’s demand for electric power far exceeds the amount it produces at present, the article said, noting fossil fuels account for 59% of total production.

It added Pakistan could build solar farms in the deserts of Sindh and Balochistan as China did in Xinjiang, which is mostly made up of deserts and mountains.

Source: The Express Tribune website, Karachi, in English 1026 GMT 18 Mar 24

title: Bangladesh media highlights 26 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a BBCM selection and assessment of key developments in Bangladesh, as reported in frontline Bangladeshi press and online media outlets as of 08:00 GMT on 26 March 2024.

Bangladesh, Bhutan agree to further strengthen cooperation
body:
Bangladesh and Bhutan on 25 March expressed "deep satisfaction" over their bilateral relations and agreed to "further" strengthen cooperation, local media reported.

A joint statement issued after a meeting between Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and visiting Bhutanese King, Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, said the two countries laid "special" emphasis on "regional and sub-regional cooperation on trade and investment, energy and transport" sectors, popular English-language newspaper The Daily Star reported.

Three memoranda of understanding (MoUs) were signed on "establishing Bhutanese Special Economic Zone in Kurigram (district), setting up a burn and plastic surgery unit in Thimphu by Bangladesh, and technical cooperation on consumer rights", while an agreement on cultural cooperation was "renewed", according to the report.

Furthermore, the report said the two countries signed a Preferential Trade Agreement for "facilitating" trade and agreed to work together in the post-Least Developed Country (LDC) graduation period for "greater benefit" of their people.

Bangladesh also proposed importing hydroelectricity from Bhutan, for which a "trilateral agreement" between Bangladesh, Bhutan and India will be needed, the report mentioned.

The "focus" of the talks was on "trade, connectivity, and regional cooperation" and on "strengthening" relations, reputed English-language newspaper Dhaka Tribune reported.

During the meeting, the two sides expressed "deep satisfaction" over their bilateral relationship, which is based on "goodwill, friendship and understanding", the report added.

The joint statement was cited as saying that the four-day visit of the Bhutanese King is a "testament of the close ties of friendship and goodwill that so happily exist between the two countries". 

Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Hasan Mahmud told journalists after calling on the King that he requested Bhutan to "re-join" the BBIN (Bangladesh-Bhutan-India-Nepal Initiative) and increase "air-connectivity" between the two countries, Bengali daily Dainik Ittefaq reported.

On importing hydroelectricity from Bhutan, Mahmud said India will "assist" in this regard as it had assisted Bangladesh in importing hydroelectricity from Nepal, the report added. 

Mahmud also said the two sides agreed to enhance cooperation in the fields of "trade and commerce, connectivity, power, agriculture, education, culture, and people-to-people contact", prominent English-language business daily The Business Standard reported.

The developments received prominent and largely factual coverage in frontline Bengali and English-language newspapers and online news outlets. 

PM Hasina urges efforts to take country forward

Prime Minister Hasina on 25 March cautioned people over "conspiracies" against Bangladesh and urged them to unitedly take the country forward, local media reported.

In a televised address to the nation on the eve of the 54th Independence Day, Hasina "cautioned" the people about the "conspiracies" against the "independence, sovereignty and economic emancipation" of Bangladesh and urged them to take the country forward after facing "all hurdles", Bengali daily Dainik Inqilab reported.

During her 17-minute speech, Hasina also highlighted measures taken by her government during the past 15 years, which have led to "unprecedented" development in socio-economic sectors, according to the report.

Hasina was cited as saying that Bangladesh has become a "role model" of development and expressed optimism that it will become a "developing nation by 2026".

Highlighting the economic achievements, Hasina said the "poverty rate, which was 41.5% in 2006, has now come down to 18.7%", while the "extreme poverty rate, which was 25.1% in 2006, has now come down to 5.6%", the report further mentioned.

Bangladesh has now become "self-sufficient" in food production and electricity has reached "100%" of the houses in the country, she added.

She also said that the "Bangladesh Awami League will never allow ruining democracy that has been earned through the blood of thousands" and thanked the people for giving it the "mandate" to rule for the "fourth consecutive" term, the website of English-language newspaper The Daily Messenger reported.

Meanwhile, in a congratulatory message sent to President Mohammed Shahabuddin on Independence Day, Chinese President Xi Jinping said he attaches "great importance to the development of Beijing-Dhaka relations", Dhaka Tribune reported, citing the Chinese Embassy. 

Xi said he stands "ready to work" with Shahabuddin "to further advance high-quality Belt and Road Cooperation and deepen China-Bangladesh strategic partnership of cooperation", according to the report.

Furthermore, Xi noted that the friendship between the two "traditionally friendly neighbours" has "grown from strength to strength", the report mentioned.

US Secretary of State Antony Blinken also sent a congratulatory message, saying that the "the United States is proud to be a partner of Bangladesh in dealing with many important issues of today, including the challenges of combating climate change, advancing economic development, responding to the Rohingya crisis, supporting peacekeeping operations worldwide, and addressing global health challenges", frontline Bengali newspaper Kaler Kantho reported.

"Our partnership plays an important role in ensuring a free, open, secure, and prosperous Indo-Pacific region," Blinken was quoted as saying.

The developments received prominent and largely factual coverage in frontline Bengali and English-language newspapers and online news outlets. 

Police dismiss alleged militant presence in Bangladesh 

Chief of the Counter-Terrorism and Transnational Crime (CTTC) unit of the Dhaka Metropolitan Police, Md Asaduzzaman, on 25 March "dismissed" reports saying that militants belonging to India's Islamic State (IS) wing had been in Bangladesh, prominent English-language news website bdnews24.com reported.

The alleged militants were reportedly arrested in Indian north-eastern state Assam on 19 March.

"This is my clear statement regarding reports of their arrest on their way to India from Bangladesh or their staying in Bangladesh that the environment in Bangladesh does not allow any militants. They don't have any hideout here," Asaduzzaman was quoted as saying.

He urged Indian authorities to inform Bangladesh "if they have any specifics on the location of the IS militants", the report said.

Furthermore, the report mentioned that Indian newspaper The Hindu had reported that the head of India's IS wing, Haris Farooqi, and his associate, Anurag Singh alias Rehan, were caught in Assam's Dhubri, near the border with Bangladesh, early on 19 March. 

A report by Indian news agency Press Trust of India (PTI) was cited as saying that they were arrested following inputs from an intelligence agency that they "would enter India through Dhubri from their Bangladesh hideout to carry out violence in India".  

Talks continue for release of Bangladeshi ship

Negotiations with Somali pirates were proceeding through a "third party" to secure the release of Bangladesh-flagged cargo ship, 'MV Abdullah', along with its 23 crew members, local media reported.

"We have regular communications with the pirates through a third party, but no remarkable progress has been made yet that can be shared with the media. The ransom amount has also not been fixed yet," Mizanul Islam, spokesperson of SR Shipping, which owns the ship, said, independent English-language newspaper New Age reported.

"We are continuing our efforts to rescue the sailors unhurt through peaceful negotiations. We are hopeful that the hostage situation will be resolved soon and we will be able to bring back the sailors before Eid," Islam said, according to a report by noted Bengali newspaper Bangladesh Pratidin. 

The development received limited coverage in frontline Bengali and English-language newspapers and online news outlets.

Source: BBC Monitoring in Bengali 26 Mar 24

title: Highlights from press, websites in Indian-administered Kashmir 22 Mar 24
snippet:
The following is a selection of major news items from select Urdu, English and Kashmiri-language press and online media sources in Indian-administered Kashmir on 22 March 2024.

Nida-I-Mashriq
body:
Politician says BJP 'broke PDP' to create new parties

Mehbooba Mufti, former chief minister of Jammu and Kashmir and president of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), on 21 March said the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) "divided the PDP" and formed new political parties in Jammu and Kashmir "so as to suppress the voice of the people". Interacting with the media in Anantnag, Mufti said after the revocation of special status of Kashmir in 2019, many political parties were formed in Jammu and Kashmir whose "sole aim was to suppress the real voice" of the people of Kashmir. She said the BJP is now trying to "give power" to these parties. She said the BJP also targeted her personally. Mufti said, "I, my brother, and my aged mother were repeatedly summoned by the Enforcement Directorate and they even evicted me from my residence in the harsh winters." She alleged that Jammu and Kashmir has been turned into a prison where anyone who raises his voice for his rights is suppressed by force. [Online, Approximate Words: 175]

[Urdu-language daily Nida-I-Mashriq is a pro-separatist daily that focuses on local issues of Kashmir. The daily is critical of the state and the federal government, and favours talks with separatists and Pakistan for the resolution of Kashmir.]

Daily Chattan

Editorial says Kashmiris dissatisfied with health facilities

A 22 March editorial said people in Kashmir are not satisfied with health facilities in government hospitals, especially with the behaviour of doctors and other staff in the hospitals. The editorial said: "People are still not satisfied with the health facilities in Jammu and Kashmir. The government has been engaged in providing modern facilities to government hospitals and other health centres for the past several years. Despite this, the misfortune is that the patients are not satisfied with the behaviour of the doctors and other staff there. There is no one to take care of patients who have no influence in these hospitals. Hospitals in rural areas have become mere referral centres for patients. Almost every patient who comes here is referred to a big hospital. Rather, it has been seen many times that patients are advised to go to private hospitals. The strange thing is that it is not possible to get treatment without a recommendation in two big hospitals of Kashmir. Perhaps being aware of this, the lieutenant governor has urged that health facilities should be provided equally to every citizen and there should be no discrimination. It is difficult to say whether this advice will be implemented in government hospitals. People sitting in such hospitals have proved to be very fearless and anti-public. They do not have any kind relationship with the patients. Rather, they have become accustomed to behaving very rudely with poor patients. Fearing them, people prefer to take their patients to hospitals outside Kashmir. Hundreds of patients go to Chandigarh, Amritsar, Delhi and even Faridabad for treatment. Such patients openly appreciate the kindness of the doctors and the passion of the other staff. Patients from there advise other people that it is better to spend lakhs of rupees outside than to spend a single rupee in hospitals in Kashmir. The only reason for this is not the professional ability of the doctors there, but their compassionate attitude." [Online, Approximate Words: 700]

[Urdu-language Daily Chattan is a pro-Kashmir separatist, pro-militant daily that is popular in the northern part of Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours talks with Pakistan for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Daily Aftab

Editorial says poll body trying to ensure better voter turnout in Kashmir

A 22 March editorial said the Election Commission is taking measures to do away with the trend of low voter turnout in Kashmir and ensure increased voting in the forthcoming general elections. The editorial said: "The Election Commission is taking steps to ensure free, fair, transparent and terror-free polling and for this, the public is being asked to vote in maximum numbers in the parliamentary elections. It is noteworthy that the commission has declared most of the polling stations in Jammu and Kashmir as 'dangerous' and the authorities have been asked to ensure that no law-and-order problem arises there. Due to terrorism, the voter turnout has been very low, and it has not been recorded more than 20-30% in Kashmir. On the contrary, the voter turnover in Jammu has always been between 60-70%. The chief electoral officer (CEO) said more parts of the Kashmir region have been declared unsafe after a recent exercise by the authorities. Therefore, the police have been asked to increase patrolling, initiate cordon and search operations, strengthen checkpoints, hold regular meetings of officers and collaborate with other security agencies to ensure peaceful elections. The CEO said the Election Commission has done away with the terms highly sensitive, sensitive and normal to ensure better turnout. He said that to prevent the activities of terrorists, anti-national elements and miscreants in vulnerable areas and critical polling stations, they have adopted a new procedure to ensure a healthy turnout. From 1 April the security forces have been ordered to be in a state of readiness so that the miscreants and anti-peace elements could not get a chance to try their tactics." [Online, Approximate Words: 600]

[Urdu-language Daily Aftab is a pro-separatist daily that focuses on local issues of Kashmir valley. The daily is critical of the state and the federal government, and favours talks with separatists and Pakistan for the resolution of India-Pakistan dispute over Kashmir.]

Tameel-I-Irshad

Police arrest three drug traffickers in Kashmir

The Jammu and Kashmir Police on 21 March claimed to have arrested three drug traffickers in separate operations in Kashmir. A police team set up a checkpoint at Bajwani Tral in south Kashmir's Pulwama district and seized 2,000 capsules of banned drugs from a drug trafficker, identified as Mohammad Amin Malik, a resident of Lurgam Tral. In central Kashmir's Budgam district, police seized 4.6 kilograms of hashish from a drug trafficker, identified as Bashir Ahmed Hajam, a resident of Qumiroo. A police team intercepted a vehicle bearing registration number JK01AR-2030 at Awantipora toll plaza, driven by Mushtaq Ahmad Chopan, a resident of Hawal Srinagar and seized some hashish from it. Police have registered cases in all three incidents and taken up further investigation. [Online, Approximate Words: 200]

[Urdu-language Tameel-I-Irshad is a pro-Kashmir separatist daily that focuses on local issues in Indian-administered Kashmir. The daily favours India-Pakistan talks for the resolution of the Kashmir dispute.]

Source: BBC Monitoring in Urdu and Kashmiri 22 Mar 24

title: Putin said 'committed to further development' of cooperation with Congo
snippet:
Text of report in English by Russian presidential website on 27 March

Telephone conversation with President of the Republic of the Congo Denis Sassou-Nguesso
body:
27 March 2024

Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of the Republic of the Congo Denis Sassou-Nguesso at the initiative of the Congolese side.

The President of the Republic of the Congo expressed his deep condolences and solidarity with the Russian Federation in connection with the barbaric terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall.

The presidents discussed the implementation of agreements reached following their meeting at the Russia-Africa Summit in July 2023. Denis Sassou-Nguesso expressed appreciation for the effective work of Russian epidemiologists in eliminating an outbreak of infectious diseases in the Republic of the Congo.

This March marks the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Russia and the Republic of the Congo. In this context, the presidents reaffirmed their mutual commitment to the further development of active bilateral interaction in the political, trade and economic, cultural, humanitarian, and other areas.

The presidents agreed to continue their contacts.

27 March 2024

Source: President of the Russian Federation website in English 1300 gmt 27 Mar 24

title: Highlights: Russia Krasnodar Territory and Adygea Media 29 Jan - 4 Feb 24
snippet:
The following are highlights from the the website of regional administration-owned Kuban 24 TV news, and the Telegram channel of Krasnodar Territory governor Veniamin Kondratyev for the period 29 January - 4 February 2024:

Ilsky mayor resigns
body:
Mayor of Krasnodar Territory's village of Ilsky Nikolai Golovko has resigned following criticism from governor Veniamin Kondratyev.

On 24 January, Kondratyev visited Ilsky, reportedly investigating complaints by locals who said municipal land was being transferred illegally to third parties.

Following his visit, Kondratyev requested an investigation from regional prosecutors and said he "believes" that Golovko "should find another workplace".

Golovko's resignation was announced on 29 January. An investigation into his work as mayor was opened. (Telegram channel of Krasnodar Territory governor Veniamin Kondratyev, 24 Jan 24; website of regional administration-owned Kuban 24 TV news, 29 Jan 24)

New military commissar

Acting Southern Military District head Vladimir Kochetkov has appointed Alexei Chugunkin as military commissar of Krasnodar Territory, who previously served as the region's deputy military commissar.

As commissar, Kochetkov will be in charge of keeping military records and army recruitment campaigns in the region. Governor Veniamin Kondratyev expressed hope that Kochetkov would "improve the work of municipal commissariats, pay attention to conduct quality recruitment campaigns and work with pre-recruitment-age youth". (Telegram channel of Krasnodar Territory governor Veniamin Kondratyev, 31 Jan 24)

Source: BBC Monitoring 4 Feb 24

title: Russia, Kazakhstan intend to 'step up anti-terror cooperation' - Kremlin
snippet:
Text of report in English by Russian presidential website on 23 March

Telephone conversation with President of Kazakhstan Kasym-Zhomart Tokayev
body:
23 March 2024

During his telephone conversation with Vladimir Putin, President of the Republic of Kazakhstan Kasym-Zhomart Tokayev expressed his deep condolences over numerous victims of the terrorist attack at Crocus City Hall, stressing that he resolutely condemns this barbaric crime, and asked to convey words of sympathy and support to the victims' families and wishes for a speedy recovery to the injured.

Both leaders reaffirmed their intention to step up anti-terror cooperation.

23 March 2024

Source: President of the Russian Federation website in English 1500 gmt 23 Mar 24

title: Russia's defence corporation makes light of EU sanctions
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Russia's state defence corporation Rostec has taunted the EU following its recent announcement of further sanctions on Russian entities, Vazhnyye Istorii (Important Stories or IStories) investigative website observes.
body:
Rostec published on its Telegram messenger channel a video which shows Kurganmashzavod plant workers on the shop floor saying "We have everything", "All is well" and "We are working".

Rostec said the EU sanctions have "not had any impact" on the plant's operation.

"The state defence order is being implemented in full," it said.

Kurganmashzavod, a manufacturer of infantry fighting vehicles, is a subsidiary of Vysokotochnyye Kompleksy (High Precision Systems), one of the holdings and organisations that make up Rostec.

Rostec said the video was Kurganmashzavod's "hard response to the EU for the new set of sanctions".

Analysing the video, IStories observed that the brand names on the machinery were obscured.

IStories said the EU first sanctioned Kurganmashzavod in April 2022.

Source: Vazhnyye Istorii (Important Stories) in Russian 7 Mar 24

title: King of Bahrain congratulates Putin on election victory - Kremlin readout
snippet:
Text of report in English by Russian presidential website on 20 March

Telephone conversation with King of Bahrain Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa March 20, 2024
body:
Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with King of Bahrain Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa at the latter's initiative.

The King of Bahrain congratulated Vladimir Putin on his re-election as President of the Russian Federation and wished him new successes in his state activities for the benefit of the Russian people.

During the conversation, that took place in a friendly and welcoming atmosphere, the leaders reaffirmed their mutual intention to continue their joint efforts on deepening mutually advantageous Russian-Bahraini cooperation in various areas - from trade and investment to environmental protection.

In turn, Vladimir Putin congratulated Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa and the Bahraini people on the holy month of Ramadan.

The leaders agreed to maintain their personal contact.

Source: President of the Russian Federation website in English 1800 gmt 20 Mar 24

title: Highlights: Russia Khabarovsk Media 26 Feb - 3 Mar 24
snippet:
The following are highlights from Khabarovsk's state-owned GTRK Dalnevostochnaya TV, Amurpress news agency, as well as Telegram channels Pulemyot Degtyaryova Z and Neshport for the period 26 February - 3 March 2024:

United Russia functionary's visit
body:
Telegram channel Neshport commented on the visit of secretary of United Russia's general council Andrei Turchak to Khabarovsk. "Indeed, as it has already been pointed out it is Andrei Turchak's second visit to Khabarovsk in the last six months. Before that he visited the region in late August, ahead of the single voting day. It is an interesting precedent... Turchak is not an official, he is a politician, in the first place... United Russia's rating in Khabarovsk Territory has significantly strengthened over the past few years, its regional branch has returned to big politics and is again one of the main political forces in the region. The factor in the renewal and strengthening of the party in the region with new functionaries at the head is a key one in the context of Turchak's attention to the region," the Telegram channel stated. (Telegram messaging app, 26 Feb 24)

Reaction to president's address

On his Telegram channel Pulemyot Degtyaryova Z the governor has praised the president's state-of-the-nation address. "President Vladimir Putin's address is looking ahead. It focuses on people, Russia and its sovereignty," Degtyaryov wrote on his channel shortly after the event on 29 February.

Speaking to a GTRK Dalnevostochnaya TV correspondent, he added: "Most importantly, while looking ahead the address is based on serious results of our joint work. Over the past 10 years there have been drastic changes in Khabarovsk Territory's social and economic spheres; new facilities have been built in Komsomolsk-on-Amur and Khabarovsk and in all our remote places and all this is the result of the president's planning and care about the Far East.

"Our region is participating in all national projects which are to be accomplished this year and will participate in all the new ones announced by the president... We will apply for all national projects," Degtyaryov assured.

In his address President Putin mentioned projects being implemented in Khabarovsk Territory, namely the development of the Baykal-Amur Mainline, ports in Vanino and Sovetskaya Gavan, the connection of households to gas infrastructure and the relocation of people from dilapidated housing, Degtyaryov recalled.

"Basically the Far East and Khabarovsk Territory are becoming not only a gate to Asia Pacific Region but to the entire world," Degtyaryov said. (Telegram messaging app, 29 Feb 24; Amurpress news agency, Khabarovsk, 1 Mar 24; GTRK Dalnevostochnaya TV "Vesti Khabarovsk" news, Khabarovsk, 1 Mar 24)

Source: BBC Monitoring 3 Mar 24

title: Turkey's Erdogan congratulates Putin on re-election - Kremlin readout
snippet:
Text of report in English by Russian presidential website on 18 March

Telephone conversation with President of Turkiye Recep Tayyip Erdogan
body:
March 18, 2024

Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of the Republic of Turkiye Recep Tayyip Erdogan at the Turkish side's initiative.

The Turkish leader warmly congratulated Vladimir Putin on his convincing victory in the presidential election and wished him further success in his state activities for the benefit of the people of Russia.

The presidents expressed mutual desire to continue close cooperation for developing multifaceted Russian-Turkish relations. They discussed issues of enhancing international stability and security, in part, in the Black Sea region.

Vladimir Putin congratulated Recep Tayyip Erdogan and all Muslims in Turkiye on the holy month of Ramadan.

It was agreed to continue dialogue in various formats.

Source: President of the Russian Federation website in English 1825 gmt 18 Mar 24

title: Highlights: Russia North Ossetia Media 19-25 Feb 24
snippet:
The following are media highlights from state-owned GTRK Alaniya TV, Severnaya Osetiya, Vladikavkaz and Slovo newspapers, Region15.ru and OsNova information portals, as well as Krylya TV information and analytical portal, for the period 19-25 February 2024:

Presidential election
body:
Digital services and technical means to ensure the openness and transparency of election procedures are to be used in the presidential election in North Ossetia, GTRK Alaniya TV quoted head of the regional electoral commission Zhanna Morgoyeva as saying at a news conference on 19 February. Polling stations will be equipped with CCTV cameras, as well as immovable boxes and special boxes for ballot papers. (GTRK Alaniya TV news, Vladikavkaz, 19 Feb 24)

The head of the regional electoral commission, Zhanna Morgoyeva, has spoken about preparations for the presidential election at a news conference in Vladikavkaz, Severnaya Osetiya newspaper reported on 20 February. About 1,350 representatives of the electoral commission will be visiting local residents at their homes to inform them about the election. Morgoyeva said that the “major information campaign will encourage the maximum number of voters to exercise their electoral right”. (Severnaya Osetiya newspaper, Vladikavkaz, 20 Feb 24)

Political

A Memorial of Glory in Vladikavkaz is to be renovated ahead of 9 May, Victory Day, following instructions of North Ossetia head Sergei Menyaylo, Region15.ru portal reported on 19 February. About 5m roubles (around $54,740 at the current exchange rate) will be spent on the project as part of the Comfortable Urban Environment programme. (Region15.ru information portal, Vladikavkaz, 19 Feb 24)

Twenty-five local residents who provide help to participants in the “special military operation” in Ukraine have been given the Team of Putin award of the All-Russia People’s Front, Region15.ru portal reported on 24 February. Head of the regional Civic Chamber Nina Chiplakova, vice-chancellor of the North Ossetian Medical College Taymuraz Revazov, director of the GTRK Alaniya TV channel Timur Kusov, war correspondent Georgy Mamsurov, co-chairman of the regional branch of the All-Russia People’s Front Ruslan Tsagarayev and other famous people in the region were among the prizewinners. (Region15.ru information portal, Vladikavkaz, 24 Feb 24)

Members of the regional parliament’s council have discussed the efficiency of using public funds in Pravoberezhny District and interaction with the business ombudsman, GTRK Alaniya TV reported on 25 February. According to parliament speaker Taymuraz Tuskayev, the district has resources to increase revenues. Currently, the bulk of the local budget is money from the regional budget. Local business ombudsman Zaur Kuchiyev said joint efforts with legislators were expected to create favourable conditions to boost business. (GTRK Alaniya TV news, Vladikavkaz, 25 Feb 24)

Fourteen people in Vladikavkaz have tried to lay flowers to the monument of political repressions after the death of Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny, Region15.ru portal reported on 19 February. According to the press service of the reginal police, the people were talked to and issued warnings against the violation of the Russian legislation related to holding of unauthorised rallies. A resident of St Petersburg, who has nothing to do with North Ossetia, was behind the event. (Osnova information website, Vladikavkaz, 19 Feb 24)

A woman in Vladikavkaz has been charged with desecrating tombs of participants in the “special military operation”, Krylya TV portal quoted representatives of the regional directorate of the Russian Investigations Committee as saying on 20 February. On 2 February, the woman scattered ritual wreathes and vases with flowers on tombs of participants in the “special military operation” on the territory of the Walk of Heroes at the eastern cemetery. (Krylya TV information and analytical portal, Vladikavkaz, 20 Feb 24)

A delegation from North Ossetia is to participate in the global youth festival in Sochi on 1-7 March, Region15.ru portal quoted deputy chairman of the regional committee on youth affairs Aslanbek Bekoyev as saying on 20 February. About 90 people will represent the republic. (Region15.ru information portal, Vladikavkaz, 20 Feb 24) 

The head of Mozdoksky District, Gennady Gugiyev, has chaired a meeting of the local anti-terrorism commission and a working group of the emergency response centre, Mozdoksky Vestnik newspaper reported on 20 February. The participants in the meeting discussed measures being taken to reveal and prevent terrorist threats ahead of Day of the Defender of the Fatherland and International Women’s Day, as well as protection of essential and potentially dangerous facilities during the presidential election. (Mozdoksky Vestnik newspaper, Mozdok, 22 Feb 24)

Economic

In 2024, about 233m roubles are to be spent on projects related to social contracts, Region15.ru portal quoted republic head Sergei Menyaylo as saying on 22 February at a meeting of the interdepartmental working group on reviving the labor market, chaired by Deputy Prime Minister Tatyana Golikova. Among other things, the participants in the meeting discussed a draft of North Ossetia’s road map aimed at improving the situation on the labour market. The document was coordinated with the federal authorities. It stipulates projects related to employment, social protection, education, the economic and agricultural sectors. Through to 2030, the regional authorities intend to help more than 7,000 local residents with employment. (Region15.ru information portal, Vladikavkaz, 22 Feb 24) 

The Vladikavkaz-based Baspik technological centre, producing microchannel plates for night-vision devices, has been put on a US sanctions list, Osnova portal reported on 24 February. The US announced a new round of sanctions, with about 500 Russian individuals and 90 legal entities on the list. (Osnova information website, Vladikavkaz, 24 Feb 24)

Military

Women representing different ethnic and cultural centres and communities in North Ossetia have visited servicemen being treated at a military hospital to congratulate them on Day of the Defender of the Fatherland, Severnaya Osetiya newspaper reported on 21 February. (Severnaya Osetiya newspaper, Vladikavkaz, 21 Feb 24)

More than 3,000 people from North Ossetia are participating in the “special military operation" in Ukraine, Krylya TV portal reported on 23 February. Since 24 February 2022, 412 residents of North Ossetia and 32 residents of South Ossetia have died in the “special military operation”. The figures are taken from open sources, the report said. (Krylya TV information and analytical portal, Vladikavkaz, 23 Feb 24)

Crime

The police in Irafsky District have seized an assault rifle, a hunting shotgun and rifles, 1,290 rounds of ammunition and 64 g of gunpowder from a local resident, Osnova portal reported on 20 February. The man claims he "inherited" the arsenal from his brother. Two criminal proceedings were initiated in connection with the case. (Osnova information website, Vladikavkaz, 20 Feb 24)

Source: BBC Monitoring 25 Feb 24

title: Russia sells 80% of oil and gas for roubles and yuans - minister
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The Russian oil and gas industry is selling 80% of its oil and gas exports for roubles and yuans, Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak has said, as quoted by the TASS news agency on 21 March.
body:
TASS said Novak had made the remarks in a documentary aired on the Premier online platform.

"According to the results of 2023, more than 90% of payments with China are made in national currencies - roubles and Chinese yuans. If we talk about our oil and gas in general, then we sell about 40% of our export products for roubles and about 40% for Chinese yuans, with 20% [of deals done in] other currencies," Novak said.

"That means that the share of the dollar and the euro is actually reduced to a minimum. I think that this trend will continue," he added.

TASS also quoted the Russian deputy prime minister as saying that many other countries were also moving to transactions in local currencies, mainly due to restrictions imposed by the West.

"Of course, many of them see this. And they understand that these risks will also affect them at some point," Novak argued.

Source: TASS news agency, Moscow, in Russian 1738 gmt 21 Mar 24

title: Highlights: Russia Dagestan Media 11-17 Mar 24
snippet:
The following are highlights from the RIA Dagestan and RIA Derbent news agencies and the website of the Novoye Delo weekly for the period 11-17 March 2024:

Presidential election
body:
Refugees from Gaza residing in Dagestan are voting in the Russian presidential election, the RIA Dagestan news agency reported.

The Dagestan labour ministry organised voting at the Delfin health resort, which temporarily hosts the refugees.

"They responded actively and came to vote with pleasure," labour minister Murad Kaziyev said. "Today, 53 individuals aged over 18 will cast their votes." (RIA Dagestan news agency, 16 Mar 24)

On the second day of the presidential election (16 March), the Dagestan electoral commission held a meeting with international observers, including from Algeria, Bangladesh, Lebanon, Nigeria, Sierra Leone and Yemen, the Novoye Delo weekly reported.

The meeting was attended by chairman of the regional electoral commission Magomed Dibirov, human rights ombudsman for Dagestan Dzhamal Aliyev and members of the regional electoral commission.

The observers were taken to the village of Dubki in Kazbek District, the city of Derbent, and the village of Khunzakh, Khunzakh District, where they met members of local electoral commissions. (Website of the Novoye Delo weekly, 17 Mar 24)

Economic

The Dagestan agriculture ministry allocated nearly 2.6bn roubles in 2023 to support the regional agricultural sector, including over 2.1bn from the federal budget, the RIA Derbent news agency reported.

"The republic is taking part in all federal programmes envisaging the allocation of budget funds for the development of the agricultural sector," agriculture minister Mukhtarbiy Adzhekov said.

Over 156,000 tonnes of rice was harvested in Dagestan in 2023, the second-best result in Russia and the best in the republic's rice planting history. A total of 1,518 hectares of new orchards was started, including 1,260 hectares of nut orchards and 244 hectares of pip and stone fruit orchards.

Dagestan sowed 182 hectares of cotton fields. The bulk fruit yield amounted to 220,200 tonnes. A total of 4,070 hectares of previously unused arable lands was turned to agricultural use thanks to melioration. (RIA Derbent news agency, 12 Mar 24)

Dagestan has been allocated over 104m roubles for the development of tourism under the relevant federal programme, the Novoye Delo weekly reported. (Website of the Novoye Delo weekly, 17 Mar 24 )

Crime

Two men were killed outside the court building in the village of Terekli-Mekteb, Nogaysky District of Dagestan, on 15 March, the Novoye Delo weekly reported.

A 14-year-old male was fatally hit by a vehicle outside Terekli-Mekteb at some point in 2023. A criminal inquiry was launched into Vladimir Grigoryants, 21, who had presumably been stripped of his driver's licence before being involved in the accident.

In June 2023, the Nogaysky district court ruled to remand Grigoryants under house arrest until the end of the year. In July of the same year, the Dagestan supreme court released Grigoryants from custody under his own cognisance. This was followed by repeated delays in the procedure by the first-instance court despite the defendant's confession.

On 15 March 2024, the defendant was sentenced to one year and six months in prison. Following this, the decedent's father shot the defendant and his counsel dead. (Website of the Novoye Delo weekly, 16 Mar 24)

Source: BBC Monitoring 17 Mar 24

title: Russia National Guard says over 650,000 officers deployed for election
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

More than 650,000 Rosgvardia (National Guard) members and thousands of private security guards have been deployed across Russia to guard polling stations during the presidential election, Rosgvardia deputy head Sergei Lebedev has said.
body:
"In total, during the period of preparation and conduct of the election, including early voting, more than 650,000 Rosgvardia servicemen and employees were involved in ensuring law and order with the participation of about 170,000 employees of private security organisations," Lebedev told a news conference in Moscow on 17 March, state TASS news agency reported.

"Public order was ensured, and it is still being ensured, at more than 11,000 polling stations," he noted in remarks cited by Russian news agency, Interfax.

Lebedev added that in the Russian-occupied territories of Ukraine Rosgvardia was providing security at more than 1,700 polling stations.

Source: TASS news agency, Moscow, in Russian 1526 gmt 17 Mar 24

title: Russia evacuates 9,000 children from border region amid attacks
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

The authorities in Belgorod Region, which borders Ukraine, will evacuate 9,000 children to other areas of Russia to avoid continuous cross shelling, Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov says.
body:
The evacuation order affects "several villages" in Belgorod District, Shebekino District, and Grayvoron District, Gladkov told a gathering of the Kremlin's United Russia party on 19 March, in remarks quoted by the state news agency TASS.

On 22 March, 1,200 children will be sent to Penza, Tambov, and Kaluga regions, with a future group being sent to Stavropol Territory next, according to Gladkov.

A total of 16 people were killed and 98 wounded due to shelling in one week, TASS quoted Gladkov as saying.

Additionally, three people, including one child, were wounded in the latest strike on the Belgorod Region on 19 March, Gladkov said on his Telegram channel.

Source: TASS news agency, Moscow, in Russian 0857 gmt 19 Mar 24

title: Russia asks Germany to recognise Leningrad blockade as genocide
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Russia has asked Germany to recognise the World War Two siege of the city of Leningrad (now St Petersburg), as well as "other crimes" committed by Nazi Germany on the territory of the former Soviet Union, as genocide, state TASS news agency reported on 18 March.
body:
"The Russian side notes the contradictory nature of the German side's approach to the issue of officially recognising crimes against humanity committed by Germany in the past as acts of genocide," TASS quoted the official document Moscow sent to Berlin as saying.

"Having recognised its crimes during the era of colonialism as an act of genocide, the German side has still not done this in relation to the blockade of Leningrad and other crimes against the peoples of the USSR during the Second World War. The Russian side insists that the German side officially recognises these atrocities of the Third Reich as acts of genocide," the document noted.

It is estimated that a third of the population of Leningrad, up to one million people, died during the 1941-1944 blockade of the city by German forces.

Source: TASS news agency, Moscow, in Russian 1333 gmt 18 Mar 24

title: Putin holds call with Kazakhstan's Tokayev - Kremlin
snippet:
Text of report in English by Russian presidential website on 2 March

Vladimir Putin had a telephone conversation with President of the Republic of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev.
body:
As a follow-up to the exchange of opinions in Kazan on 21 February, 2024, the presidents discussed certain current issues on the bilateral agenda, with a particular focus on the implementation of joint projects in trade, the economy, transport, logistics and energy.

Kassym-Jomart Tokayev specifically emphasised the substantive and forward-looking nature of the Russian President's Address to the Federal Assembly.

The leaders reaffirmed their commitment to comprehensively enhancing the relationship of allied and strategic partnership between Russia and Kazakhstan.

Source: President of the Russian Federation website in English 1100 gmt 2 Mar 24

title: Russian TV news: Ukraine accused of orchestrating concert hall attack
snippet:
Main themes on Russian primetime TV news on NTV, Rossiya 1 and Channel One on 25 Mar 24

Suggestions of Ukraine's complicity in the deadly concert hall attack just outside Moscow were front and centre on the primetime TV bulletins on state-owned Rossiya 1 and state-controlled Channel One.
body:
The attackers were radical Islamists and Tajikistan nationals, but the attack itself has "Ukrainian fingerprints" all over it, the channels told their viewers, echoing remarks made by President Putin at a meeting with his security services.

The two channels also accused the West of trying to exonerate Ukraine despite the supposed evidence pointing to its complicity; of allowing the attack to happen by giving Moscow insufficiently specific warnings; and of being more worried about the harsh treatment of the suspects than about the innocents killed in the attack.

Putin doubles down on suggestions of Ukraine's complicity

The deadly attack against the Crocus City Hall concert venue may have been committed by Islamist radicals but all the evidence points to Ukraine as the organiser of this terrorist outrage despite Western attempts to exonerate the 'neo-Nazi Kyiv regime', President Putin suggested late on 25 March during a video conference call with the heads of the Russian security services.

Channel One launched straight into Putin's lengthy remarks at the start of its primetime news bulletin. Rossiya 1 showed them at the end of its programme as soon as the footage was ready to air. NTV missed them because its primetime bulletin comes out too early, but aired them at the start of its late-night news.

"The crime was committed at the hands of radical Islamists... But we can also see that using various channels, the United States is trying to convince its satellites and other countries that according to its intelligence, there are no Kyiv fingerprints to be found on the Moscow terrorist attack, and that the deadly terrorist attack was committed by followers of Islam, by members of ISIS... We know very well whose hands were used to commit this outrage against Russia and its people. What we want to establish is who gave the order," Putin was shown saying.

He repeated the earlier Russian claim that the suspects were supposedly heading for the Ukrainian border when they were apprehended hundreds of miles from Moscow, and hinted at Western complicity by suggesting that "those who have been fighting against our country using the neo-Nazi Kyiv regime as their instruments" may have been behind the latest attempt to "intimidate" Russia.

The same narrative was promoted by Rossiya 1 and Channel One in other reports about the terror attack.

Rossiya 1 showed a pundit claiming that the "signature" of the attack was uncharacteristic of ISIS terrorists, and that the attackers must have been recruited online by the Ukrainian secret services.

It is common knowledge that Ukraine has been actively recruiting agents in Russian territory, arming them and providing them with detailed plans for future attacks, the pundit said.

Over on Channel One, a correspondent also made much of the unsubstantiated claim that the attackers were heading for Ukraine when they were apprehended, ignoring reports that the place where the suspects were caught is much closer to the Russian border with Belarus than with Ukraine.

The Russian-Ukrainian border "is almost impossible to cross amid the ongoing special military operation", but the attackers were promised a warm welcome on the Ukrainian side of the border, the correspondent claimed.

Hints at Western complicity

Putin's latest remarks aside, the bulletins on Rossiya 1 and Channel One were rife with accusations against the West over its possible role in the attack and its conduct in the immediate aftermath.

In the headline sequence at the top of the bulletin, Rossiya 1 suggested that exonerating Ukraine was the paramount US concern at the moment.

"The West is afraid of finding out that Ukraine may have been complicit in the terror attack in Moscow. How will they live with that knowledge?" the channel wondered later in the programme.

"In the very first hours, when Russian investigators were only just starting to gather evidence and the attackers had not even been caught yet, the West had already settled on its preferred version of what had happened: Ukraine is above any suspicion, and the attack was committed by a branch of ISIS," the channel said in a tone of indignation.

It later suggested that US instructors had trained the Ukrainian secret services to commit precisely the kind of attacks that took place at the Crocus concert hall.

Another charge Rossiya 1 levelled at the West was that the Western warnings of an impending terror attack in Russia made in early March were deliberately vague and not actionable - and that the West therefore bears part of the blame.

The warning received from the US embassy in Moscow on 7 March "did not contain any details", and the White House is now refusing to offer Russia any assistance in the investigation, the channel told its viewers.

It then highlighted a clip in which a caller phones in to a French talk show and says in a Russian voiceover that the "MI6, US intelligence, and we the French are to blame for what happened because instead of telling the world about the impending threat, we were all too busy trying to destabilise Russia and Putin".

Treatment of the suspects

There was also much outrage on Rossiya 1 over the observation in the Western media that the suspects appear to have been badly beaten or even mutilated before they were paraded in front of TV cameras.

"According to reports in the Western media, they have more sympathy for the terrorists rather than the families of the victims," a Rossiya 1 presenter fulminated.

A Rossiya 1 correspondent later accused Germany's "traditionally Russophobic Bild newspaper" of trying to "portray the butchers as victims".

The channel itself made no secret of the suspects' physical condition when they appeared in court.

At one point it showed close-up footage of one of the suspects in court while a correspondent remarked on a huge and untidy bandage covering the man's right ear.

The channel made no mention of the graphic footage circulating on pro-Kremlin Telegram channels (and discussed with apparent approval by some of the top Russian newspapers) on which the suspect's ear is seen being deliberately cut off after he was apprehended.

Source: BBC Monitoring in Russian 1900 GMT 25 Mar 24

title: Putin, Krasnodar governor discuss state of region's economy
snippet:
Text of report in English by Russian presidential website on 12 March

Meeting with Krasnodar Territory Governor Veniamin Kondratyev
body:
7 March 2024, Krasnodar

Vladimir Putin held a working meeting with Krasnodar Territory Governor Veniamin Kondratyev.

Starting the meeting, the President noted that the Krasnodar Territory was developing well, almost all its key performance indicators were good, and unemployment, which is at its lowest in the country, was below the national average in the region. Investment numbers are very good. Population growth is a core indicator, which, of course, raises social issues, such as increasing the number of ambulance crews and the capacity of kindergartens and schools.

Mr Kondratyev reported that the economy was steady and had adapted to the challenges and difficulties. The gross regional product amounted to four trillion rubles in late 2023 compared to two trillion rubles in 2018. Regional producers and businesses gained access to the domestic market. The ability to increase capacity and sell output on the domestic market is an important factor of growth.

The Governor also said that seven industrial parks had been built in the Krasnodar Territory, and seven more were under construction. Infrastructure loans, which the region receives from the federal budget as directed by the President, are crucial, especially for resorts. These loans will be used to build 17 treatment facilities on the Black Sea coast. The construction will begin this year.

Regarding the agro-industrial complex, last year's harvest was quite good, even though not a record breaker at 14.4 million tonnes, of which wheat accounted for 9.6 million tonnes. Enterprises had sown 1.8 million hectares with winter crops and started sowing spring crops on 1.8 million hectares as well. A decent harvest is expected this year. Agrarians have been provided with fuel, fertiliser, and seeds in full. As of the end of last year, the agrarians have purchased various types of agricultural machinery worth 23 billion rubles. The law on viticulture and wine making has launched a new industry which was non-existent in the region literally until 2019, when wine making was a garage business. Since the time the law was passed in 2019, 1.5 billion bottles of champagne and wine have been produced. Last year alone, 305 million bottles were produced. Drinking wine and champagne from local wine material derived from local grapes grown in the Krasnodar Territory is now a sign of sophistication.

Veniamin Kondratyev recalled that the Industrial Development Fund established with the President's support already has 7.1 billion rubles. These funds are spent on upgrading enterprises and import substitution production lines. The interest rate is kept low, under four percent. Last year, industrial product sales reached 1.8 trillion rubles. Owing to the fund, the amount of industrial output grew by almost 45 percent in five years.

Vladimir Putin also noted that investment in the health resort industry has increased a lot - from 18.6 billion to 488 billion. Veniamin Kondratyev said that due to the enactments of a corresponding territorial law, investment in new hotels has grown by 20 times since 2020. Currently, 48 hotels worth a total of almost 500 billion rubles are under construction in the Krasnodar Territory. About 30,000 new rooms will be ready for use by the end of next year. The Krasnodar Territory is the health resort and spa centre of the whole country. Last year, 18.6 million people spent their vacations there. This is a record, but not the limit. There will be demand for the hotels that are now under construction. The President emphasised the need to maintain continuous control over the quality of service.

Schools and kindergartens were discussed as well. According to Mr Kondratyev, 90 schools, 194 kindergartens and 214 sports facilities have been built since 2016 when he became governor. Of this number, 42 schools, 61 kindergartens, 49 sports facilities and 70 general practitioner offices and rural paramedic centres have been built under national projects in the past five years. A total of 1,300 parks and squares were also improved under a national project.

Vladimir Putin noted the need to focus on the facilities in poor shape. Their problems should be resolved as soon as possible. They should undergo major repairs or be replaced with new facilities. Mr Kondratyev explained that about 30 clinics are under major repairs while 43 hospitals have already been rebuilt. The Governor emphasised that on the whole, the Krasnodar Territory received 260 billion rubles under this national project. This amount of social construction is unprecedented for the region.

Source: President of the Russian Federation website in English 0700 gmt 12 Mar 24

title: Russian film-maker jailed for posts about Ukraine massacres
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Russian documentary film-maker Vsevolod Korolyov (Korolev) has been sentenced to three years in a penal colony for spreading "fakes" about the Russian army, according to Russia'scourt system.
body:
St Petersburg's Vyborgsky District Court convicted Korolyov under Part 2 of Article 207.3 of the Russian Criminal Code, the US-funded Russian-language website Nastoyashcheye Vremya (Current Time) reported on 20 March, quoting the city's court press service.

The court also banned him from administering websites for four years, the report said.

According to the prosecution, Korolyov published two posts on his VK (VKontakte) social network page containing "false information about the use of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation against civilians during the special military operation in Ukraine".

Specifically, these related to "the mass murders of civilians in the city of Bucha, the the urban settlement of Borodianka, as well as a shelling of the city of Donetsk", prosecutors were quoted saying.

The case against him was opened in July 2022.

Source: Telegram messaging service in Russian 1321 gmt 20 Mar 24

title: Russia resumes production of projectiles for Tyulpan heavy mortar - report
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Russian government daily Rossiyskaya Gazeta says that the country has apparently resumed the production of "the world's most powerful" mortar projectile for the 2S4 Tyulpan 240-mm self-propelled heavy mortar.
body:
Reviewing Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu's recent visit to artillery round and aviation bomb production lines in Nizhny Novgorod Region, Rossiyskaya Gazeta spotted a photograph showing a large mortar projectile. It identified the munition as the high-explosive 53-F-864 mortar projectile, the primary ammunition for 2S4 Tyulpan.

"It was clear that the freshly painted munition had been produced quite recently, although the production of these most powerful mines in the world had ceased several decades ago," Rossiyskaya Gazeta said.

The report noted that 2S4 Tyulpan mortars are part of the "reserve of the supreme high command".

"They are sometimes called 'doomsday' weapons, since their munitions can include nuclear mines with a TNT equivalent capacity of up to 2,000 tonnes. However, conventional high-explosive charges in Tyulpan's munitions are more than effective simply due to the unique characteristics of the mortar," it said.

Rossiyskaya Gazeta praised the accuracy of 2S4 Tyulpan and said that these heavy mortars are being used in Russia's "special military operation" in Ukraine.

Source: Rossiyskaya Gazeta website, Moscow, in Russian 1537 gmt 28 Mar 24

title: Russia writes off Guinea-Bissau debt
snippet:
By BBC Monitoring

Russia has forgiven Guinea-Bissau's debt totaling nearly $26.7m, with an additional $960,000 to be restructured, state news agency TASS reported on 19 March, citing the corresponding agreements between the two countries.
body:
The debt covered by the first agreement includes about $25.1m under a 2001 agreement, related to past Soviet obligations, inclusive of accrued interest, as well as about $1.5 million for the rental of premises for the embassy in Moscow.

The second document concerns a debt and an accrued interest of about $960,000. Under the new agreement, Guinea-Bissau commits to spend this sum to finance projects aimed at enhancing the population's access to vital resources, among other objectives. Additionally, Russian companies should be granted access to competitive selection processes on terms no less favourable than those provided to local and other entities.

The two agreements are presented as continuing the past measures promised to be undertaken by Russia as a part of global debt relief initiatives.

TASS reminded that Guinea-Bissau President Umaro Sissoco Embalo met Russian President Vladimir Putin during the Russia-Africa summit in 2023. Putin then assured his counterpart of Moscow's support and noted the great potential of the African republic in cooperation in the extraction of minerals as well as energy and infrastructure projects.

Last year, Putin said that Russia had written off over $20bn from African countries and pledged more aid in a move thought by analysts to entice arms sales.

Source: TASS news agency, Moscow, in Russian 1627 gmt 19 Mar 24

title: Putin address Leaders of Russia competition winners - Kremlin text
snippet:
Text of 'Meeting with winners of Leaders of Russia competition' published in English by Russian presidential website on 12 March

Meeting with winners of Leaders of Russia competition
body:
Vladimir Putin held a meeting with the winners of the Leaders of Russia national management competition.

The Leaders of Russia national management competition is a project of the Russia - Land of Opportunity platform launched in 2017 on the Presidential instruction to identify promising new-generation leaders and to support their career advancement. The ceremony for presenting awards to the winners of the 5th season - 102 managers from 31 Russian regions and two foreign countries, Belgium and Serbia, - took place in Moscow on February 25.

* * *

President of Russia Vladimir Putin: Good afternoon and welcome everyone.

This meeting with graduates of the Leaders of Russia format and platform is a regular event that is held with a simple goal in mind which is, first, to congratulate you on your achievements and, second, to hear what you have to say about the event and what you have learned during your contacts with each other and during conversations and classes that were held in various formats. This is the fifth class of graduates, and over a million people have been trained under this system over the years. Probably, this is the largest human resources forum internationally, not just in Russia, which is impressive.

It is crucial that the people with whom you met and talked and who formulated the tasks and assessed the results, have achieved much themselves and were in a position to assess your accomplishments objectively.

The third point that I would like to highlight is that this year you were able to work in the regions. I am aware there are people in this audience who work in the regions as part of their regular job, but nevertheless, it was important for everyone else to try their hand at addressing problems at the regional level. This is a critical element of training and competitive selection, as well as determining one's own abilities.

I would like to thank our colleagues in the regions, the regional leaders, for providing this opportunity.

I am also pleased to note that the number of applications, which was very large, includes more and more people who live permanently outside of Russia, but show interest in our country and want to work in Russia. They are eligible for expedited and simplified procedure for gaining Russian citizenship, and 29 people have already made that decision. These people were originally from 12 countries, such as the United States, France, Greece, and Bulgaria, as well as the CIS countries. A total of 29 people from 12 countries.

It is also important that we are involving our colleagues from the new territories, the new regions under the Leaders of Revival programme. I know that they are here as well. You will tell us how it all went.

You also know that we have opened a new page - this is the Time of Heroes [personnel programme]. They are in this audience as well - those who have taken part in serving the Motherland in the special military operation zone. We have been receiving applications since March and 30,000 applications have already been submitted.

Obviously, the selection must and will be strict enough. This will not be a one-time event but a regular process. So those who do not make it in the first attempt have every chance to send another application and get onto this platform. And for those who do not have a university degree, we will create the conditions for receiving it, if that's what they want, if they have such ambitions.

Obtaining a specific position is not an end in itself in these events. However, at least 470 people are already working in high positions and in the federal centre. I believe we have six deputy federal ministers, five deputy governors and governors in the regions, 10 people head municipalities (I see some of them here) while others work in the State Duma, the Federation Council, and our big companies with state participation - in general, in the most diverse areas and at a sufficiently high level.

It is very important that during this training, a certain community of people is taking shape. I am referring to those who undertake training and go through this competitive selection. What also matters, and I heard this from graduates in the previous years, is their ability to maintain these relations and exchange useful information that can be used at a specific job. I will repeat that this information comes from sources you trust and from the people that are very competent in their own areas.

This is probably all I wanted to say in the beginning. I would like to listen to you more, and I repeat, to hear your assessments and your proposals on improving this personnel selection system.

I have already said this many times, but I would like to repeat it again. The main advantage of this work, the main advantage of this system of training and selection is that it does not work through pull or by using one's connections. What matters is one's own personal and professional skills.

Go ahead please.

To be continued.

Source: President of the Russian Federation website in English 1900 gmt 12 Mar 24

title: (Corr) Antidepressant sales in Russia at five-year high - report
snippet:
(Inserting correct link to Vedomosti report)

By BBC Monitoring
body:
The number of packages of antidepressants sold in Russian pharmacies is up by 33% year-on-year, reaching a five-year high, according to a report by the business newspaper Vedomosti.

About 3.6m packages were sold in the first 11 weeks of 2024, up from 2.7m in the same period last year, the paper reported on 26 March, quoting data collected by analytics firm DSM Group.

Escitalopram, an SSRI, and trazodone, a serotonin modulator, are the two most commonly sold medications, according to the report.

Source: Vedomosti website, Moscow, in Russian 2139 gmt 26 Mar 24

title: Highlights: Russia Ingushetia Media 19-25 Feb 24
snippet:
The following are highlights from the website of the Ingushetia administration, the website of the state Ingushetia newspaper, and the Magas and Fortanga news agencies for 19-25 Feb 24:

Ukraine
body:
Employees of the FSB regional office, in collaboration with the regional executive committee of the People's Front, prepared over 20 tonnes of long-term storage products ahead of 23 February and the second anniversary of the start of the "special military operation" (SVO) in Ukraine, Magas news agency reported on 20 February. This aid, part of the "People's Front. All for victory" project, includes a variety of goods to support soldiers, demonstrating solidarity and mutual assistance, the report said. (Magas news agency, 20 Feb 24)

The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine officially recognised the Ingush people's right to create their independent state and condemned Russia's historical crimes against them, with 248 out of 450 members voting in favour, Fortanga news agency reported on 23 February. The resolution supports Ingush's self-determination, condemns past atrocities, and calls on the international community to back the cause, following diplomatic efforts by the Ingush Independence Committee. (Fortanga news agency, 23 Feb 24)

Bagaudin Gandaloev, a soldier who died during the "special military operation", was laid to rest in Sagopshi village, Malgobek district, with condolences offered by regional officials, Ingushetia daily reported on 25 February. The Deputy Prime Minister, representing the Head of the Republic, pledged support to the deceased soldier's family, including his wife and infant daughter, the report said.

Political

A patriotic event featuring the "Strength in Truth" promotional train will take place in Ingushetia on March 10 from 3 to 6 p.m. at the Nazran railway station, including exhibitions on Heroes of Russia and local history, as well as cultural performances showcasing the region's art and heritage, Ingushetia daily reported on 20 February.
